Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Carlo V
Reviews.Content: Very central location, few steps from Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia The hotel is located in not modern building, with beautiful furniture Service standard: I had to start in the early morning and they give me a cup of tea and a sandwich nothing special and without kindness Beautiful rooms, sometimes noisy, maintenance to improve

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Everything”
Reviews.Author: selliot64
Reviews.Content: Because we stayed for 5 nights the hotel picked us up from the airport which was very handy late at night. Location could not be better - right between Haggia Sohpia and the Blue Mosque, a 5 minute walk to each. The hotel is in a lovely little street with many restaurants, a convenience store on the corner and a travel agent. The rooftop breakfast room was amazing. Apart from the great continental breakfast the views were wonderful. It was worth paying a little extra for a Superior Deluxe room which gave us a bit more space and and windows overloking the street. We booked directly with the hotel via their website and got a discount....maybe because of the length of our stay I'm not sure. Yes the toilet in the bathroom clogged up a few times and cable conncetion on the tv was iffy but they got fixed and were only small glitches in the wonderful stay. I would definately stay there again and have recommended the place to friends who have also had good experiences there.

Reviews.Title: “great location and service”
Reviews.Author: wide_eyesPerth_Wa
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 9am tired from an overnight flight ex Singapore and was invited to have breakfast, and wash and was then shown where to change money a short walk away, with apologies because my room was not ready! ( I had just hoped to leave my bag!) I thought breakfast was great, a choice of cereals, local breads, cheeses, meats, olives, yoghurt, fresh and dried fruits, preserves, juice, tea, coffee etc, what more could one want? I loved the hotel being so close to the Blue Mosque, though I would recommend a very early visit to avoid crowds.I was awed by Hagia Sophia, enjoyed shopping and the trip on the Bosphorus and recommend an organised tour to the Palace for info and to avoid queues. Coming back to my little room as a solo traveller was always welcoming and restful..like being in a gracious guesthouse. Best of all I was there at the end of Ramamdan and after delicious traditional lentil soup and lamb in the cafe opposite and a walk among the couples and families admiring the illuminated mosques at 9pm I wandered to over to the back of the Whirling Dervish cafe for a cool drink...there 3 musicians arrived and began to play and to my surprise a young man in dervish robes appeared .I watched for 2 hours..I will definitely be coming back to Istanbul with my partner and will definitely be staying at Hotel Uyan.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: samarrai
Reviews.Content: Good location, friendly staff , if you book direct on the hotel web site you get 8% discount on cash payment but not through third party , rooms are good but the floor below the restaurant are noisy from customers moving the chairs, breakfast is good but only one or two serving and you need to ask them to refill the trays. Free one way pick up from airport , some hotel in the area offer free return trip and 10% discount on cash payment

Reviews.Title: “only one complaint”
Reviews.Author: AndyM953
Reviews.Content: good location. good staff, good service, great bed. VERY small double room, in fact smallest double I have ever seen, although it did have a balcony. Would recommend hotel but avoid corner/balcony rooms if possible.

Reviews.Title: “The best location in Sultanahmet, loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: ResmeN
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in the heart of Sultanahmet and wanted to be as close to Ayasofya and Sultanahmet mosques as possible so we chose to stay at this hotel. Together with 4 Seasons, Uyan Hotel are the 2 closest hotels to the Sultanahmet area. It literally took us a 2 minute walk to reach either Ayasofya or Sultanahmet. I also loved the view from the side we walked to the main square from as it was great. How I would have loved to live during the Ottoman times. The hotel manager was very quick and detailed in all their email responses. Nearing our trip I realised we needed to have a large suitcase stored somewhere in Istanbul till I returned back to Istanbul as we would be staying in Istanbul at the end of our trip so we asked the hotel if they could store the large suitcase and they were only too happy to oblige at no cost. This made us happy and the hotel already had a plus in our minds. I chose this hotel based upon the internet reviews I had read and believe me none of them were wrong and we are glad we chose this hotel. Their breakfasts were delicious. They had a great roof top terrace eating area which has a great view. The hotel staff were extremely helpful, approachable and friendly in assisting with all of our queries. The hotel is in a very quiet location and street noise or other annoying noises were nonexistent. The only noise there was is the beautiful call of prayer to the mosque to which we accepted. Because we stayed at the hotel for 5 nights we were entitled to an airport transfer which we utilised upon arrival there. Our plane was delayed to which we told the hotel and they advised their driver has access to the arrival details and would be waiting for us at arrivals. We arrived at the domestic terminal of Istanbul airport but had to go to the international terminal to sort something out so the hotel gave us the driverâ€™s number where we arranged to meet at an alternative place which worked out well. Definitely will stay at this place on our next visit to Istanbul and can highly recommend it to others considering a hotel in the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul. Twin share room cost us 100 lira per night. I give it 4.1 stars http://www.uyanhotel.com/

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great service, great location, enjoyed my stay.”
Reviews.Author: 26SAJ
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews before booking and was not disappointed, great location close to blue mosque , Hagia Sophia, Topkaki palace are all walking distance. the friendly & helpful staff, I recommend the She tours number 6 tour which goes across the bosphorus bridge also you get a boat trip & lunch included in price & get to see beylerbeyi palace.... enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: hellodolly9445
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located to all the main attractions of the Old part of the city. Rooms were clean and comfortable but a bit dated. Breakfast was good. Staff very friendly and helpful. I am glad we stayed in this area of the city, felt very safe and the shopkeepers loved to chat and often tried to get you to come in their stores or restaurants but in a fun way. The people in Turkey our warm and inviting, thanks for the great holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent Service & Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Farah D
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Istanbul and the helpful and comfortable hotel Uyan experience made it a wonderful experience. The hotel was clean, modern and in the perfect location. the staff were extremely helpful and accomodating. It gave you a very homely feeling. The staff spoke good english and took care of arranging all your transfers, trips and whatever you would ask them. I have never had such a great personal hotel service. The buffet breakfast was good and the Bazaar, Blue Mosque and Hagia Sohia were just steps away..I stayed in this hotel from a recommendation from a friend and it lived upto its expectations. I will be referring this hotel to all my family and friends and will definitely come back and stay there. It was defintely worth the value. Thank you all at Hotely Uyan.Farah

Reviews.Title: “Best Place Near Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Clayton T
Reviews.Content: We staye there for a week this October. My wife staye dthere a few years ago. Both stys were incredible. The rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. The fresh breakfast provided every morning in the rooftop dining room is VERY good and gives guests an outstanding chance to mingle with other travelers and reap the benefits of their experiences in this amazing city. All staff members are helpful and speak such good English that my wife and I (very poor Turkish speakers) had no difficulty at all in resolving some complicated travel plans.The location is perfect as it is walking distance to many days worth of sightseeing and everything else you would want to see is easily reached by the conveniently located light-rail station. Can't recommend this place any more highly!

Reviews.Title: “Top spot”
Reviews.Author: poddy
Reviews.Content: Location Location Location very close to Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia Mosque (museum). Hotel provided breakfast which was great lots of fresh produce , view from top deck was of the marama sea great , rooms that our group had were on all floors and all were ok with no complants, top floor room has 2 single beds smaller but good views , 1st and 2nd floor rooms were at back but still ok, plenty of room , good bed inportant YES etc special over 4 days free pick up from airport , Staff very help full, local area had plenty of food venues of all types , one we tried was a cooking school by day and resturant at night , set menu but excellent food.. . Attuka i think ? easy walking to most main attractions, trams, ferrys etc

Reviews.Title: “Best choice in the medal of tourist area .”
Reviews.Author: Khaledi
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay . everything we needed here, including very obliging staff . I got Comfortable room with my family I would like to express my sincere regards and appreciation to all reception deck staff by the name Mrs Arzu she was the first person who i meet in hotel she offered for us good comfortable room . quite hotel all tourist area very near jest to walk few minute & all kind of transportation are close . lovely place to stay in honeymoon and ask the administration of hotel to offer for honeymoon. i will be back to Istanbul to stay in this Hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Best location & hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frogger313
Reviews.Content: My daughter, grandson & I stayed at this lovely hotel at the recommendation of friends & we weren't disappointed. Very comfortable, clean, great breakfast included, in the heart of the old city & within walking distance to most attractions - Blue Mosque & Aya Sofia just behind the hotel. Very safe - could walk the street any time of day or night. Staff very friendly & helpful - they even kept our excess luggage for us while we travelled throughout Turkey & then came back to stay our last night before we flew back home to Toronto & Ripley , Ontario, Canada. Would highly recommend this lovely hotel to anyone & would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: tinman3
Reviews.Content: Can not imagine a better place to stay for a visit to Istanbul. The staff were helpful but not overbearing. We were upgraded to an excellent room beyond our expectations with a view to the Blue Mosque on one side, Aya Sofia through the trees on the other, and a peaceful courtyard with a fountain below. Breakfast was fine with everything we would care for in a continental buffet. Location was perfect in Sultanahmet, with a short walk to the main sites just around the corner but tucked into a very quiet tourist area with plenty of shops to choose from nearby. At the end of the stay my son forgot his stuffed dog in the room, and the staff had no problem to send it to us at no charge, no complaints. We are living in Cairo so hope to get back to Istanbul soon, and will definitely try to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in the perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Kvallens
Reviews.Content: We stayed here six nights and had a great visit. Rooms are clean and the service is great. Very friendly and accommodating. Ask for a room with a view. Great restaurant right around the corner called med cezir!

Reviews.Title: “Uyan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Milton_8
Reviews.Content: Thanks to hotel staff, very clean, very helpful and we enjoyed our stay there. (Five nights in October, 2 couples from Calgary, Canada.) We enjoyed walking to the local restaurants and had great pick-up service from the airport. Istanbul is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “It's all true: Friendly, Spotless, and in a PERFECT location”
Reviews.Author: kansasforever
Reviews.Content: You really can't do too much better than this place. Minutes from the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque, the Hotel Uyan has a great view of both from the rooftop terrace... be sure to spend some time at sunset checking out the view. Lovely but simple room, clean, comfortable and traditional. This is not a generic 'cookie cutter' hotel, but a genuinely Turkish style hotel experience. Great value for money and a friendly and helpful staff... they were on hand even very late at night. I can't recommend this place enough and would gladly return.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location and a laid back atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Sam W
Reviews.Content: The danger of staying in a hotel smack bang in the middle of a main tourist area is that there is never any reprieve from hassle. Hotel Uyan proves this to be wrong and more. It's small cobbled street is quaint and yes it has carpet sellers and cafes but it never feels too busy. The staff at Uyan make you feel like you are the only one that matters and part of the family. Asking them to do something is never a problem and they do not pressure you for a tip. Internet is free and the buffet breakfast is great and just what you need before hitting the major sights that are 2 or 3 minutes walk from your door.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: snoopybrook
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the perfect location for visiting all the main tourist sites in Istanbul, The Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace etc. are all within a 5 minute walk. The hotel does not serve dinner but the Turkish breakfast is very good. There are many good restaurants locally. Would use again. Don't forget to go the roof terrace and take in the view, day or night it is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “A Cautionary Note”
Reviews.Content: There is no doubt that this is a good hotel in an excellent location with welcoming and helpful staff and useful extras such as free wi-fi, free airport pick up for stays over 3 nights and 8% discount for cash payment. Based on reviews here we had reserved a deluxe room but were upgraded at no extra cost to a superior deluxe, which was spacious, comfortable and well-appointed. However, the bath/shower had a high side and limited space between the fixed shower screens on the side of the bath, which could be a problem for anyone with restricted mobility. The hotel staff were very willing to help us overcome this problem firstly by providing a step and, when that was not successful, arranging for the use of a walk-in shower in a single room, which had been vacated early one morning. I would definitely recommend this hotel but for anyone with restricted mobility it would be worth checking out access to the bath/shower as the hotel told us that all the deluxe rooms had a similar arrangement.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Uyan”
Reviews.Author: TripAd85
Reviews.Content: We arrived within a large party of 10, we were helped with our bags and checked in by the friendly informative receptionists. Two couples within the party were upgraded to a blue mosque room, which was nice. The reception staff were very helpful, he booked us into a local turkish bath, and organised tea on the terrace for us. Our bags were taken up to our room, and we were shown everything in the room and how to work it. The rooms were spacious and very clean. The roof terrace is lovely with spectacular veiws of the blue mosque, a lovely place for breakfast, and to relax. The location of the hotel is perfect, a short walk to the blue mosque, bazzar, shops, and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, comfortable quarters”
Reviews.Author: Constance P
Reviews.Content: for a splendid visual experience in the Old City, get the large 4th floor "Blue Mosque view" room overlooking the garden of Yesil Ev, an adjoining guest house. The staff are helpful, the hotel location perfect for exploring all the sights in this part of the city on foot and by tram. The breakfast is traditional and has enough variety so that one can escape cucumbers, tomatoes and yoghurt and still feel ready for the day with boiled eggs, fresh fruit, toast and cereal. The presence of the Sultanahmet Four Seasons two buildings away means that you're never far from a wonderful meal in an historically important place, a fresh copy of that day's International Herald Tribune, and a convenient ATM. The rooftop patio offers a beautiful view. Staff were obliging about making phone calls for us and booking reservations at events. Transport from the airport was included, which was a real plus, since we arrived at 11 PM.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and homy rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Venisiana D
Reviews.Content: Uyan's location is definitely great, only a few hundred meters from main landmarks in Sultanahmet. Just a pity the bathroom, especially the shower box is too small even for petite size like me, and it's not well-lit. The corridors are equipped with movement-censor lamps that light only for a few seconds (a bit irritating to me), causing the place to be a bit dark. Breakfast time starts at 8am, which is a bit late for those who enroll themselves for city tour. Uyan also has dining tables at the rooftop but no waitress stood by. At night, we can hear people chatting on the street because the windows are made of wood. But overall, we were happy with the staff and ...the free wifi in the rooms really make up for everything :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Hunter A
Reviews.Content: I just retunred from my first trip to Istanbul, where I stayed in the Hotel Uyan. It is a very nice hotel ideally located near several of the great attractions of Old Istanbul, The Aya Sofia, the Blue Mosque, the Cisterns, and the Bazaar, and is a five minute walk from the tram. The people at the desk could not have been more helpful or friendly. My single room was quite small, but enough, and the bathroom was very nice. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A gem!”
Reviews.Author: tonelle
Reviews.Content: What a great little treasure! When booking our trip to Istanbul I was looking for a great location in the Sultanahmet district and could not have made a better choice! The hotel is quaint and charming and the staff are friendly and helpful. We booked a small room and it was definitely small, but as we did not spend a lot of time in our room so really it was perfect. The room was clean and that was all that was really important to me. We were at the hotel our first week in Turkey and it definitely made a good impression. At the end of our trip we had one last night in Istanbul and booked the Uyan again. It was a great decision. We kept our windows open the entire time we were there and waking to the sounds of call to prayer from the Blue Mosque was one of the highlights of our time there (also....there are no screens on the windows but the most we saw of any bugs was two tiny moth-like creatures that flew in....not a fly, not a mosquito, not a spider to be found!!) The location could not be better....less than a minute walk to the Blue Mosque and Ayasofya. The roof top terrace gave spectacular views of both as well as the Bosphorus. Breakfast is included and featured the traditional Turkish fare of olives, cheeses, cucumbers, tomatoes and yogurt along with cereals, eggs and toast. Having breakfast on the terrace was unbelievable! A definite recommendation for this gem of Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Best location!”
Reviews.Author: tcardona
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Uyan in early September. Everything was wonderful! Great price, the best location, great/helpful staff! The room was low key but nice, bathroom impectable! The breakfast in the morning was very lovely and generous. The Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia are a 5 minute walk(or less) from the hotel. The street is pedestrian only, so pretty quiet. The only down side was that the air conditioner was a bit warm still for the hot sultry weather. The gentleman at the front desk was SO helpful, and arranged pick up from the airport for us. On the way to the cruise ship, he called a taxi for us and it was there literally in 2 minutes! Don't hesitate to stay here!! But don't expect a spa or room service-but who needs that with Istanbul at your feet!

Reviews.Title: “Great value---30 yards from the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler0003
Reviews.Content: I loved this property. My client was at the Four Seasons, but the Uyan was literally 30 yards away. The food at Hotel Uyan was good: vegetables, eggs, cereals, yogurt, and fresh fruit (YUMMY CHERRIES!) The standard double room was perfect, but I'd avoid the small double unless you're under 4 feet tall!

Reviews.Title: “A Pretty Good Hotel in THE Touristy Part of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: JzeroT1937
Reviews.Content: My first night at the Hotel Uyan was a delight--largely because I'd spent the past 36 hours hopping an endless series of connecting flights that took me from NYC to Italy, Germany, and finally, Turkey. The staff is very kind and the building itself very decorative. Living in New York and traveling through western Europe often, I've begun to truly appreciate a hotel that provides genuine living space, and Uyan provides just such space--provided you reserve a "Standard" room or better. I peaked into the "Small Single" room and it looked pretty cramped--perhaps for a traveling student or longtime studio dweller these would be fine, but for a man of my size (6'8") and temperment (grouchy and bitter), I'm glad I went with the standard. The windows open out onto the city street, meaning you get to look out at whatever's below, but also that whatever's below will wake you up. And believe me, it will wake you up. There was a man who came through the street collecting trash on a wheel barrel yelling something in Turkish--it was like the "Bring Out Your Dead" scene from Monty Python and the Holy Grail; this happened around 9:30 every day. The roof offers a restaurant and beautiful views of the Haghia Sofia and Blue Mosque--make sure you don't miss it. This place is located just behind both of the aforementioned landmarks, placing it front-and-center amongst tourist sites. This can be a traveler's dream or nightmare. As a traveler who prefers the nightlife and feel of the "real" city, this was a little removed from everything--Beyoglu and Istiklal Caddesi are far away, and even that area is a "tourist" hotspot. For the real nightlife you have to take the ferry over to Kadikoy on the Asian side, which is quite a trek on the public transit system. This area is generally very quiet at night and I slept quite well. The bed was large and plush, the bathroom eminently European (IE teensy weensy shower cube-ish), and the room generally large and well cooled by the AC. I would recommend, but only if you're not an extremely light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: GlobalguyOttawa
Reviews.Content: The Uyan staff picked us up at the airport and took good care of us. The staff were helpful and friendly. We asked for the room with a tiny balcony overlookign the street. It was amazing to watch people during the call to prayers. The upper terrace has amazing views. Breakfast buffet is generous but predictable.

Reviews.Title: “5-Star Location and Hotel Quality”
Reviews.Author: BestIslands
Reviews.Content: From the rooftop terrace you get the 2nd best view of the Blue Mosque and St. Sophia in all of Istanbul, and at a reasonable price for our spacious, high quality room No.207 that comfortably slept three. This is a quality small hotel that is hard to beat on any measure: location, views, rooms (even a Jacuzzi bath in our room), staff service and breakfast. We will not repeat in detail what others have said, but to reaffirm Uyan Hotel as the place to stay when in Istanbulâ€™s old town.

Reviews.Title: “5 star location with a million dollar view”
Reviews.Author: chartiers
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week at Hotel Uyan with our family of 6 and are so happy with our choice of location. From the amazing rooftop terrace (my favorite part of the hotel) you could see the Hagia Sophia on the right and the Blue Mosque on the left. We were able to walk to many of the major sights and it was an easy walk to the metro for those that were further away. We booked two deluxe rooms and they were clean and spacious. Breakfast each morning was nice, with good variety of cereals, yogurt, eggs, breads and fruit. The area around the hotel is clean and quiet and there are several excellent restaurants very close by (Cafe Rumist, The Meat House). It was a perfect location for a wonderful vacation. We will stay here again if we get to come back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, professional, friendly service, clean.”
Reviews.Author: Frantickly
Reviews.Content: You couldn't ask for a better location. I was really pleased to find this hotel so conveniently located from some of the most beautiful sights this city has to offer and within a short 3-5 minutes walk to one of the main tramways to easily travel across town, including to the ferry terminals and the Asian side. A very clean and professionally run hotel, the staff were polite and helpful. The rooftop terrace has unbeatable views - a highlight of my stay in this city. Small negatives for me was the lack of coffee and tea making facilities in my room and the very tight squeeze of the 'small double room' that I was staying in (I got what I paid for), including its outlook onto residential homes at the back of the hotel. The room also happened to be facing a section of the building (the back) that was home to what seemed like hundreds of sparrows - and their shrill noise occasionally became very intense when one was trying to relax. Overall, this was a good value for money hotel and I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: robertobleme
Reviews.Content: The location was great, the staff very kind, the room was very nice, with enough space. A lot of restaurants in the neighborhood. I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A homely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jewlzcee
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean boutique hotel that is about a 1 minute walk from the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and Topkapi Palace. The breakfast was included and provided a variety of different foods. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Our twin room was a bit small and there was little space for our 2 bags for the 7 night stay. Apart from that we had a most enjoyable stay in this hotel in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel & Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: migueldeportugal
Reviews.Content: My fiance & I stayed at the Uyan Hotel in the Sultanahmet region of Istanbul for seven nights during the last few weeks. The accommodations were very comfortable and the staff were extremely helpful throughout our entire stay. They even upgraded our room to their deluxe suite during our final night in Istanbul. The hotel is conveniently located near the tram to get you into other parts of Istanbul, but also on a quiet side street so that you're away from the masses when you need a break. Also, the terrace view is recommended during breakfast and in the evening. Excellent views all around.

Reviews.Title: “Well placed but underwhelming hotel”
Reviews.Author: PeterJohnCotton
Reviews.Content: I was slightly diappointed by this hotel having seen the relatively good trip advisor ratings / comments. The staff are extremely nice & helpful and the place is well located in amongst the main attractions (but so are many others). Breakfast on the rooftop terrace is another plus, but they really don't make best of that feature - no bar / restaurant like many of the other hotels which is a shame. We had a "small double" and it was incredibly small - not somewhere you could comfortably spend time outside of sleeping. I would recommend the hotel, but only just and with the caveat that you don't go for a small room!

Reviews.Title: “A long-standing affair”
Reviews.Author: Climacus71
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at Uyan Hotel, Istanbul every June since 2008. June is an exciting but busy time in this city of cities, with hundreds of thousands of tourists and variable weather; these conditions often mar a short stay. Furthermore, I usually visit the city with my students and have to cater for their needs. For all these reasons I need a central, friendly and efficient hotel that is also good value and can accommodate visitors of all budgets with dignity; this is why I return to Uyan over and over. The location is ideal, the rates are reasonable, the staff are charming, the roof terrace offers sensational views over Hagia Sophia and the Sultanahmet Mosque; the rooms are clean and have air-conditioning; the decor is updated frequently. I have stayed in other hotels in the city with similar rates and better reviews in guide books but they somehow lack in comparison. My choice for my next visit is easy!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel would go back”
Reviews.Author: jacky_knight
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel the rooms are spotless, the staff are friendly the location is perfect, the breakfast delicious and the views amazing. I stayed their whilst attending a conference

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location for that trip to old Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: Island-Jay
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel for that trip to Istanbul. Your on a quiet street with that traffic is barred from using so you can sleep with your windows open. Your within a minutes walk from the the Blue Mosque, Hippodrome any more carpet shops known to man kind. The hotel is 50' from the the front door of the Fours Seasons Hotel. Rooms were great. We had 3 rooms: A Deluxe Douple (307) and 2 Double Rooms (403 & 404). All rooms were clean, well appointed and had space. The roof top deck a dream view is dream to eat breakfast on, what a view! The hotels's website does a great job describing the the hotel(no Photoshop). We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kaz012
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of package We were in the best room in the house overlooking the Blue Mosque so cannot vouch for the other rooms .Awesome views from rooftop The breakfast is basic and we had to help the floor manager tidy our room as it was forgotten ..but I would recommend for the location...

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: dolphin2185
Reviews.Content: We were a family of six staying in their basement apartment. It was spacious, extremely clean, and well maintained. The location was perfect - just a 5 min walk from The Blue Mosque. The breakfast in the morning was great. Best thing about the hotel was the staff - They were very helpful, friendly and caring. I would def go back to this hotel!!! Extremely well managed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: TomPopel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Hotel Uyan on the second leg of our Turkey trip, we wanted some where fairly central so we could see the sights. Generally Istanbul is baking hot and humid in august so having a base in the centre was a great help! The hotel staff were fantastic, very hospitible yet not too in your face. Our room was on the ground floor and was great value for money, much classier than what we're used to. The room was very clean, had all the right extras and was more than comfortable. We only ate there for breakfast, and didn't sit on the rooftop, mainly because of the crows and the heat. Crows will steal food off your plate if you leave it unattended but its worth going up there for a coffee and taking in the views. For our money (and we tend to travel on a tight budget) we loved hotel Uyan, I'm already recomending it to my friends and family to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: Jnas1
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in this hotel, conveniently located in the Sultanahmet. Our room was a good size, comfortable beds, jacuzzi tub, big windows opening to views of the Bosphorus. The breakfast was served in a bright room that led to a rooftop area with spectacular views of the Blue Mosque and Hagai Sophia. The food was fresh and attractively served. The staff was helpful and attentive. highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “We found this hotel ideal as it was only 2 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque and the other tourist attractions”
Reviews.Author: JCB1132b
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is situated a few minutes walk from the major tourist attractionsof Istanbul. On the roof terrace there are fine views of the Blue Mosque and the surrounding area. The front of the Hotel is not disturbed by traffic noise at all just the noise of seagulls and the Call to Prayer in the ealry hours of the morning. An ideal place to stay. The building has been modernised and is immaculate The bedrooms are furnished well with flat screen TV and safe and comfortable beds. The bathroom was larger than was expected and the shower exceeded expectations. The breakfast buffet is plentiful with lots to chose from to eat and drink. We found the staff friendly and efficient. We used the shuttle service from the airport and we were driven straight to Hotel Uyan and then picked up on our departure date. All very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “latest on uyan”
Reviews.Author: chhase243
Reviews.Content: We were recommended to stay here by several friends who were there last year. First it is an ideal location!! I can't say enough about the ease to everything...our lonest walk was to dinner and it was only 15 minutes. Our room was OK.......they were full this week....it had 1 window and VERY low lighting on the 2nd floor...........wish we could have gotten a better room. Alomost all the staff were friendly..........but very quiet unless spoken to first. For a good quick meal go to the corner and turn left to Haggia.....there is a small restaurant........med ceviz is the name. Tony runs it and he is phenomenal!! All of his staff is awesome......food is good and tasty. He will treat you like a brother..he is from NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in a perfect spot - Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: EtainVeronique
Reviews.Content: This is a delightful hotel, ideally situated in the heart of Sultanahmet. It is about a 7 minute walk from the Sultanahmet Tram stop, between the Blue Mosque and the Haga Sophia. We were given a warm and friendly greeting from the hotel staff who were all smiles when we dragged ourselves in at around 1am. We each had a single room, and although small, they were comfortable and clean. Breakfast is served each morning on the top floor and offers a nice variety of Turkish cheeses, meats, breads, and the usual selection of cereals and yogurts. The staff are friendly, courteous, and helpful. They are always on hand to answer any questions you may have or to give assistance or advice on local tours. The hotelâ€™s fantastic roof terrace offers the best possible view of the Mosque â€“ you could literally spend hours sitting in the sun, mesmerized by the presence of it. The terrace also offers a sea view, although it is mostly blocked by another hotel. Itâ€™s a lovely place to sit and enjoy the sounds and smells of Istanbul after a long day of touring the city. The hotel is ideally located, with lots of great restaurants and cafes within walking distance. I donâ€™t believe I have anything negative to say about it â€“ it was perfect for what we needed it for and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in heart of historic Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Catlover75
Reviews.Content: My lifelong dream of travelling to Istanbul came true in March 2011. My stay at Uyan Hotel only enhanced my visit o Istanbul. The hotel is incredibly clean, situated on a quiet steet but just steps away from the breathtaking Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and Topkapi Palace. It is also close to the Tram, making it very easy to access other parts of the city. The hotel is beautifully decorated and has a lot of character and charm. The rooms are well furnished, comfortable and clean. The room rates are very reasonable .The staff are friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family visitng Istanbul. I hope to get another chance to travel to Istanbul and woiuld most certainly stay at Uyan Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location ....and great staff”
Reviews.Author: SpringsTraveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel Uyan - At first glance we were a bit nervous after our Barcelona hotel and our room was a bit dark -- but large. The staff happily moved us to 307 which was a floor up and had 3 large windows. The room was quiet and it was easy to sleep till 9:00 am. From our roof top, we could practically touch the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia minarets. Four seasons Hotel was just steps away. Room was the biggest we'd stayed in since starting our trip. Bed was large too. Big enough for two women to sleep comfortably. Breakfast was included and plentiful. Overall ratings: Looks 3; staff 5, location 5 and price 4.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, wonderful staff, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Murf32
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights and really enjoyed my stay. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly â€“ nothing was too much bother. I thought the breakfast buffet was good value for money and the free Internet access was much appreciated. The hotel is located slap bang in the middle of the main tourist district so it's easy to get your bearings. You can walk to all the main attractions â€“ even down to the harbour area and the tram/buses to the Tunel district stop close to the hotel. Overall I was really satisfied with the hotel and will stay there again â€“ there is so much to do and see in this fabulous city that one weekend just isnâ€™t enough! However, I must mention the one slightly negative experience we had. We booked a â€œsmallâ€� double room online and were surprised how cheap it was. Once I saw the room, I realised why! The room was TINY â€“ approx. 12 sq m. After one night we decided to upgrade (we had to pay a little extra because the only room available was a deluxe double. The second room was fabulous - a king bed plus a single, massive bathroom with a Jacuzzi tub. There was nothing wrong with the first room apart from the size and Iâ€™m sure a lot of people would have preferred to put up with that and spend the extra money on shopping or going out for dinner etc. But after one night I was already sick of stepping over my trolley to get to the loo â€“ there was only room for one of our cases in the bedroom so mine was stashed in the bathroom! Despite having to pay extra, the â€œhugeâ€� double was still terrific value for money! And I would definitely recommend this hotel â€“ just be aware that if you book a (cheap) small double that it will be rather cosy!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CharleyWood
Reviews.Content: Very impressed! I stayed here for less then a week and I donâ€™t think I could have found a better hotel. The place was very clean, relaxing and in a fantastic part of the city (around the corner from Aya Sofia and the Blus Mosque. 15 minutes walk, or two tram stops, from The Grand Bazaar). The prices were very resonable as well. Couldnâ€™t recommend this place more. There are lots of different shops and resturants nearby too. It was very nice hearing the call to pray at different times of the day because of all the mosques nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Uyan is wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: amygutman
Reviews.Content: Hotel Uyan was our first stop in Turkey--which was my first trip abroad in quite some time. I was a bit nervous about dropping into this new culture, but Hotel Uyan was a wonderful introduction. We were picked up at the airport without a hitch after having made reservations online and from start to finish everyone was so friendly and helpful. We especially loved breakfast on the roof, looking out over the storied Istanbul skyline. If you're looking for a simple, clean, quiet hotel in the heart of Sultanahmet, look no further!

Reviews.Title: “Uyan - a real find among hotels!”
Reviews.Author: annemarikbergstrom
Reviews.Content: A hotel very close to the big mosques in Istanbul. You meet a really friendly staff who is ready to help. On floor 4 you find the breakfast buffÃ© with more to offer than expected for the hotel rating - free access to internet nearby. Upstairs the breakfastroom you have a terrace with an spectacular view of Hagia Sofia and The Blue Mosque.A frech looking bathroom and comfortable double beds, turkish carpets on the floor - and a wake up call from the minarets make you feel nearly like a sultan. If you are going shopping you walk from the hotel in 10-15 minutes and the you are at the Grand Bazar. . We really recommend the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “If you avoid room 101 (yes, thats what its called) then its a great value place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Brodiej
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend over Valentines this year. We paid around Â£40 a night so weren't expecting the world, and the deal included breakfast.....but were disappointed on arrival to be allocated a room approximately 3ft from the reception, 1ft from the office, and one that contained twin beds...great for Valentines. Not. Its room 101 by the way. It was fine inside, but being that close to people checking in, coming back, leaving in the morning was quite off-putting. Next day we asked to move, and luckily they were able to get us room 303 which was a double with a balcony, probably smaller than the last one but one that felt much more comfortable. My experience was that the hotel was super clean, in an amazing location (you can walk anywhere from it), and has lots of character. At Â£40 a night, i think it represents amazing value and i'd happily stay there again. I'd recommend Turquoise Restaurant which is nearby too.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and staff are friendly and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: TonyDaMata
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable stay, the hotel is peaceful and attractively decorated and furnished as well as very well run with friendly helpful staff always willing to go the extra mile to help out. Thoroughly recommended as a real bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value, great staff. A finding in Sultanahmet.”
Reviews.Author: sofiacrater
Reviews.Content: My parents and I loved this hotel. We chose it based on TA comments and it is really what has been said here about it. From online booking to check-out, the experience couldnâ€™t have been any better. Itâ€™s really well-located, only a few meters from Ayasofya, Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace, in a quite calm pedestrian street. We stayed there in two different periods and in two different rooms for 3 days each: a spacious underground suite with living room and 2 large bedrooms (with also a small garden, that must be great during summer â€“ unfortunately, it was raining heavily and it was pretty cold in Oct, and we couldnâ€™t enjoy itâ€¦) and then on 3rd floor with a great view from Sultanahmet neighborhood. By the way, the terrace on the top floor is amazing! We didnâ€™t have breakfast there because of the cold weather but we took maaaaaany pics from Ayasofya and Blue Mosque from up there. Rooms were spacious (even with my extra-bed, which was by the way, a blast, compared to other folding beds that are usually rather uncomfortable), clean and decoration and furniture is on the well-conserved antique style. Breakfast is fine, with a good selection of food (local or not). The staff is just great. Booking process, transfer arrangements, suggestion of city tours and everything we needed, they provided. Whatâ€™s best: always with a smile on their faces and giving their best to please us (especially Mr. Murahem in the front-office, whoâ€™s really nice and attentive). We felt like old guests every time we arrived from our tours! We definitely recommend the hotel and weâ€™d gladly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Rico57_11
Reviews.Content: I spent Dec 29-Jan5 at this hotel; had never been to Istanbul before and used the reviews on the 'net as my guide. I was given the 'honeymoon suite' on the 4th floor and was very happy and impressed. Large room, comfy bed and the view was excellent. The staff was really great- Arzu looked after the front desk, Canan works upstairs in the cafe and Oktay the night shift guy were all happy, helpful and friendly. Highly recommended; it ain't cheap but you get what you pay for, especially in Sultanahmet. Rick

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: globetrottinreviewer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few days in September while sightseeing in Istanbul. Great place--the location is ideal, just a stone's throw from Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. You can have breakfast (the hotel has an excellent buffet) on the roof and see both of them. Single rooms are a bit small, but this isn't a big deal--it is Istanbul and you should be out and about, after all. A great value for the price, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and cosy”
Reviews.Author: Ebz83
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome. Went there for our honeymoon and loved it. It Beats all the 5 star hotels ive stayed in to date! Great location, great breakfast, clean rooms... What more can i say. The rooms are kind of small'ish but you cant really get any bigger around that area unless you go for large well known 5 star type resort. They only have 2 rooms with a balcony, but if its possible i suggest you take it! Its a very small balcony but its an amazing feeling to watch the people walk past on the uneven paved roads at dusk while sipping on a cold drink. The best part about it is the Terrace. You have fantastic views on either side. To the left you have Hagia Sophia, to the right The amazing Blue Mosque and infront you have the mesmerising Bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “nice cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: youngcoupleIraq
Reviews.Content: location very good near to sultan ahmed jamiee & tram station near & easy to transport , you can get good tourist services near the hotel , the rooms very clean & very comfortable , breakfast is good with nice hall, hotel staff freindly & helpful ...thanks to Mr. Muherem for his good managment & freindly treatment,,,,, we like to come & stay in this hotel on next vocation ....

Reviews.Title: “Definitely deserves a better rating...”
Reviews.Author: Jewels_Gva
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. The location is fantastic for a 1st time visit to Istanbul, literally seconds away from the Blue Mosque. Very nice rooms (particularly if you choose a superior one), ultra clean, tasteful decoration and great staff! Plus it's a real bargain! Don't hesitate to stay there !

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel and great staff”
Reviews.Author: AbdullahMohammed
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me by a family member and i stayed there on honeymoon with my wife. The staff were extremely polite and always happy to see us. If i went to Istanbul again i will definitely be staying here again. The views from the roof terrace are breathtaking and the breakfast provided was a of a good variety and quality. We had originally booked a double but they upgraded up to a honeymoon suite, which was really plush. Overall inclluding a great location near the Blue Mosque 5/5

Reviews.Title: “Great location & staff”
Reviews.Author: Wooders1
Reviews.Content: The location of the Hotel Uyan is fantastic. Walking distance to many of the major sites in the city, and only minutes to a tram stop. Lots of great restaurants nearby too. The rooms are nicely furnished and while not luxurious, they are very comfortable. The staff were great - nothing seemed too much trouble and they always greeted our requests with a smile. When the upstairs bar was booked by a private party one night, the staff were happy to arrange for drinks to be served for us and our friends in the downstairs lobby, which we appreciated very much. We also liked the transfer service from the airport to the hotel (and back). I would definitely stay at the Hotel Uyan when we are next in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: NiCoLe8275
Reviews.Content: a friend recommended this hotel. the staff were all friendly and helpful--they always had a great restaurant to send me to, the map that i needed, etc. the hotel is located in the pocket between hagia sophia and the blue mosque. there are a lot of excellent restaurants and a small bazaar where i would recommend making your purchases. as a woman traveling alone i felt safe in this hotel, as well as the area surrounding it. the other business owners on the street are very nice and kept their eye on me. if i should return to istanbul, i would definitely stay here again. my room wasn't anything fancy, but it was clean (and well maintained) and comfortable (great bed!). the first night i stayed in a double room because there were no singles available and the room was gorgeous--i was a little sad i didn't just spring for the double for the entire stay. thank you, hotel uyan!

Reviews.Title: “Great and friendly place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tigu090
Reviews.Content: With a location this central in the heart of historic Istanbul, a few steps away from Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque, restrained and tasteful decor, very good and friendly service and competitively priced - it is really hard to find fault with the Uyan Hotel. Warm-hearted people here. We certainly enjoyed it, and plan to be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, walking distance from...”
Reviews.Author: Drfarheena
Reviews.Content: Nice location, walking distance from Topkapi palace, Hagia Sophia & blue mosque..Nice breakfast, rooms small .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in this hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: Haligonian2010
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in this hotel. The staff were very helpful and so willing to translate into English for us language-deprived foreigners.We so enjoyed the view from the rooftop patio with the Blue Mosque and Haghia Sofya just beside us.A lovely selection of breakfast foods each morning with cheerful staff, minutes from all the sights of Sultanahmet and all reasonably priced as well. Thumbs up!!

Reviews.Title: “all positive at the hotel Uyan.”
Reviews.Author: Exploreitall
Reviews.Content: Hotel Uyan was great before we even got there.Responding to my emails from Canada regarding a transfer from the airport and a rental car.Sure enough there was a car waiting for us apon arrival allthough the flight was quite late.Arriving in the sultanamet we were not able to get the car up the street we stayed on,the young boys took our luggage carried it up the street to the hotel and then said their farewell quickly ,too quickly for us too tip them. The front desk was helpful and anything they were not able to help us with there was a travel agency right across the street. The room was one of the biggest rooms we have stayed in in Europe.The bed one of the most comfortable and the pillows and bedding wonderful.Air conditioning worked great too.In this room we had no view but that was ok because the roof top view was beyond spectacular and every morning we ate breakfast up there over looking the blue mosque,Aya sofia, and the bosphorus.Breakfast was adequate continental meal.choice of hard boiled eggs and a cooked egg and weiners in tomato sauce for hot item choices. All the places of interest Aya sofia blue mosque topkapi palace to name a few were within 2 blocks.the grand bazaar a few more but still within walking distance.There is a nice shopping area/bazaar right at the end of the street it was quite nice too. Since we decided to stay in istanbul an extra night we needed to change rooms so we went up to the top to the blue mosque room where we had a magnificent view out of every window of the blue mosque and a street view from the balcony.We had coffees brought up and sat up there relaxing on the balcony. Again we had a car take us to the airport .The hotel staff come out to the car with you and wish you well. I would stay here again I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in super location”
Reviews.Author: helers_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a single room for 3 nights in October. The room was clean and very comfortable and the views from the rooftop terrace were amazing. 2 mins walk to the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sofia.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor service.”
Reviews.Author: peaches934
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Uyan in Istanbul this past August. The hotel is very clean and our room was very nice and comfortable.The hotel location is great- very central to all the main sites in Sultanhamet yet on a very quiet street. The views from the rooftop are incredible definitely a plus during breakfast since the one that the hotel serves is mediocre at best. The service is also poor. The maid service is great but the front desk was a mess. Not only did they screw up our wake-up call, calling us at 7am instead of 11am but they also gave us wrong directions on several occassions- if they even gave us directions, sometimes they just told us to cab it instead of taking mass transit which they swore did not go to our location of choice, only to find out that the bus stop was right in front of the place. The staff also spoke poor English.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Rooms, Location”
Reviews.Author: priya619
Reviews.Content: Very quaint hotel located in the heart of Sulthanamet near metro station. Hotel was very accommodating, safe, and provided excellent service to us. Staff was very friendly, helpful, and they even mailed me something valuable I left behind. Rooms are charming with a nice view and rooftop terrace area. Also was a really great value for the location, quality, service, and total package!

Reviews.Title: “Look no further in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: MonumentRoy
Reviews.Content: The Uyan Hotel is your place to stay! Rooms were very large, clean, and tastefully decorated. The bathroom was large and featured a whirlpool tub. A safe was included and a wide range of television was available. The rest of the hotel featured a beautiful rooftop eating area where the included breakfast can be eaten. There are few more scenic views of the city. The seating area near the lobby is a great place to sit and relax. The location is absolutely perfect, inside the historic walls of Constantinople. The Blue Mosque is minutes away, in addition to other impressive sites. The Artist's Bazaar is a very short walk and is a great place to shop. It is located directly across the street from The Four Season's Hotel, if that speaks for the location itself. The best part of the hotel was the customer oriented staff. They will stop at nothing to make sure your stay is pleasurable. I can't say enough. You will NOT be disappointed if you stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, well appointed & close to everything”
Reviews.Author: paul_swinyard
Reviews.Content: We are a mature (50'ish) Australian well travelled couple and we stayed in a superior deluxe room for 4 nights which was very large and tastefully decorated. We booked on line and it cost us150 euros per night. The hotel arranged a free airport pick up at 5:00am (included) and we checked in on arrival at no extra cost. The rooftop terrace and buffet breakfast was basic but adequate, but the views were fantastic, blue mosque and hagia sofia. We had just arrived from a 5 star hotel in Hong Kong but we did not feel as though we were plummetting down in standard at all, we arrived early there and had to wait until 11:00am to check in. My wife was recovering from knee surgery so we were worried about getting around, it wasn't a problem at all we walked to all the major sites including the grand bazaar. Plenty of restaurants nearby and facilities such as banking and shopping. would definately recommend, but would try somewhere else if we returned as there seem to be many nice hotels in this area.

Reviews.Title: “SPLENDID”
Reviews.Author: ArlingtonTxSaiid
Reviews.Content: I stayed in hotel Uyan in Jul 2010 and went back there in Aug 2010 again because the location is excellent , service was very good , and staff were very nice and helpful , if I go to Istanbul again , hotel Uyan will be where I will stay .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, lovely hotel, great location, and amazing breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: nightowl611
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Uyan Hotel are wonderful, and Muharem in particular was extraordinarily helpful, friendly, and upbeat. The hotel's location - a five minute walk from either Aya Sofia or the Blue Mosque, and a 6 minute walk from the tram - is ideal. I reserved a small single room and because all such rooms were full, I received a free upgrade. I am a woman traveling alone and felt very safe in this area at all times. The hotel is also in the middle of many outdoor restaurants, hookah bars and coffee shops. And the breakfast was phenomenal and very generous. I recommend this hotel 100%!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sherpaVA
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy like its Four Seasons neighbor, just a great location, comfortable room, and friendly service--the Uyan Hotel capped a perfect vacation to Istanbul. A whirlpool bath hit the spot after a full day of sightseeing in mid-summer. And we'll always remember breakfasts on the roof-top terrace with stunning views of the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. We look foward to booking at the Uyan on future trips to Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good”
Reviews.Author: Airundo
Reviews.Content: The Uyan Hotel is quite nice. Small single room is really small, but there's everything a traveller needs: a bathroom with shower, safe, even TV (very small). One problem - there's a some smell in room, vinegar or something... Room service is not bad, but for this price isn't good enough. I stayed 4 nights but the towels never changed. Reception is ok. Sleeping here is very hard - because of seagulls cries. But I guess it's not a hotel's problem. As for location, it's about 4-5 minutes by feet to Aya Sofia. Also there's "a restorant street" near hotel, but no supermarkets (at least I haven't found any). If you need a modest, but nice hotel, Uyan is a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: BJ_Summers
Reviews.Content: Pros: great location near principle tourist sites and many eating places, staff was truely friendly, clean, spacious rooms. About 30 minutes to Ataturk airport. Cons: well maintained but older building; near enough to Blue Mosque that you might be called to prayer while you're trying to sleep. We enjoyed our stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great location in old city, good service”
Reviews.Author: travelingsun
Reviews.Content: In June of 2010 we stayed for 5 nights at Hotel Uyan and had a very good experience. The hotel is located in between the Blue Mosque and the Haghia Sophia church, 1.5 blocks from each one. I arrived alone, before my travel companion arrived, and the staff made an extra effort to make me feel comfortable. During our visit, they recommended local food places that were not expensive and helped us with directions to the tram, the wharf and nearby markets. The elevator was great for our 4th floor room. They serve a stunning Turkish breakfast (also on the 4th floor) and the best feature---the roof-top patio where you can sit and enjoy the splendor of the Blue Mosque and Sophie, the old, old church. Rates were compatible with other central locations.

Reviews.Title: “good,clean and safe”
Reviews.Author: mohammadsignaller
Reviews.Content: clean,safe,good service,friendly,staff friendly and helpful. (especially Mr muhaffram and Mr Alper at reception, walking distance to Blue mosque,aya sofia,tram staion,cafes and restaurants and shopping areas.even outsid estreet safe and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, ideally located, helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JamesWoodbridge
Reviews.Content: I can highly recommend this hotel. It is very well situated with the main sites of Sultanahmet only a few minutes walk away, and some great restaurants nearby for the evening. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is thrown in with the price (very reasonable) and you can take it outside to the rrof terrace with fabulous views in all directions.

Reviews.Title: “We recently stayed at the Uyan hotel in...”
Reviews.Author: rah37
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Uyan hotel in Istanbul and must say it is a very nice place to stay in. Cannot say enough good things about it. The location and room was the best thing about this hotel as were the gorgeous views from it's terrace and the wonderful staff especially Mr. Muharram who was especially kind and welcoming to us, and the other staff who took such good care of us, Saleh and the other gentleman and the girl who served us at breakfast and Ms Humeyrah the manager whom we didn't meet but who responded so promptly to our request for a room and gave us a good rate. The superior room we got was very large and tastefully done, the beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was a nice size with all amenities. Everything was very clean and new. The hotel is just around the corner from the Blue mosque and Haghia Sofia mosque and Topkapi palace. It had beautiful views from it's charming rooftop terrace to the Sea of Marmara (and I think the islands and Bosphorus)the blue mosque and Haghia Sofia to the other side. The room was surprisingly very quiet compared to it's proximity to various cafes and restaurants in the area which are all nearby. The breakfast was adequate with various breads, cold cuts, egg omelettes, cheeses, jams, cereals and tea coffee and juices. All in all a wonderful stay in a wonderful city. The hotel is also within walking distance to the grand bazaar and a tram station that goes to all parts of the city. An added bonus was the free arrival airport transfer. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place; superb location”
Reviews.Author: wandering_bob231
Reviews.Content: Uyan is within walking distance of all the major tourist spots in Istanbul and nicely situated in an area full of restaurants and pubs adjacent to the Blue Mosque. The hotel staff was helpful and polite. The rooms are okay--but if you are going to stay here it would be good to pay the extra 30 euros and get the deluxe room. The standard room is small and only comes with a single bed. Nice breakfast, as well. This is really more of a nice three-star property than a four-star property . . . but I would definitely recommend it for a couple of days in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Perfection”
Reviews.Author: kevinwragg1
Reviews.Content: A friend of ours recommended this hotel to us as she had stayed there previously; she said it was â€œLovelyâ€� â€“ something of an understatement. After a rather unpleasant transfer from Ataturk airport, hour and a half? Driver really didn't know where he was going, we arrived at the Hotel to find the Deluxe room we had reserved was not available - not a problem as we were instantly upgraded to a Superior Deluxe room for three nights until our original room became available. Both rooms were very spacious, very comfortable, and VERY clean, both rooms had great bathrooms with Jacuzzi, both rooms also contained very large beds & TV's. Although we didn't dine at the hotel, we took full advantage of the breakfast buffet every morning on the rooftop terrace. The views were stunning on all sides, the Blue Mosque to one side, the Hagia Sophia on the other & the Bosphorus flowing to the Sea of Mamara too! The hotel is located in a very quiet area of Sultanahmet but very close to all of the sights mentioned above, plus Topkapi Palace. All are within five minutes walk from the Hotel (except for the Bosphorus). Lots of cafes, restaurants, rug and ceramic shops, grocers and even a barber (Gentlemen, I recommend a shave and head massage!) a few steps from the doorstep. We particularly enjoyed the Cafe Mesale, where you can relax of an evening, drinking Turkish tea & coffee, eat kebaps to your hearts content and smoke a Nargile/Hookah (water pipe) all to the accompaniment of traditional music and watch Sufi dancing (whirling Dervish). The Staff of the Hotel could not be more friendly or helpful and were always very polite. If you wish to book any activities whilst you are staying in Istanbul you can also do this through the Hotel. We booked a Bosphorus cruise, unfortunately, we failed to notice that the day we wanted to book the cruises didn't run (oddly neither did the cruise company). The member of staff at the Hotel who booked the cruise for us, Muharrem (lovely chap) did notice later, asked our permission to re-schedule our trip, and then insisted the cruise company should provide us with a free lunch and wine for the inconvinience. Muharrem, after we had told him of our experience with the transfer company phoned them up for us to "confirm" we wouldn't miss our return flight - we didn't. Yes, do be aware of the proximity to the Blue Mosque, and as a consequence the early morning call to prayer - I personally found it a beautiful sound and really quite comforting. If it's not for you, take some ear plugs, I always do when I travel, but that is usually because of the inconsideration of fellow guests. We booked with this Hotel because of the recommendation of a friend, plus we wanted a nice hotel that was reasonably priced for our Honeymoon. It not only ticked all the boxes, it exceeded them. We really do want to say a very big thank you to Muharrem and ALL the staff at the Hotel Uyan for helping to make our Honeymoon so very special - we will definitely stay with you when we return to Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful retreat in the shadow of the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofya”
Reviews.Author: MaryLouY
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in this delightful boutique hotel in a Deluxe room with a view overlooking the graceful garden of a neighbouring hotel. The hotel was a great success in every way - room was spacious, well-appointed and very comfortable, Wireless Internet was reliable, breakfasts were great. The staff were all very friendly and only too eager to help with any requests. It was such a short walk to the major venues of the old city, and just a 5 minute walk to the tram stop, so convenient - and easy to come back to during the day for a quiet time. We could sit on the roof-top terrace and sip an apple tea or a beer, or even a raki, surrounded by views of the Marmara Sea, the Bosphorous, the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofya. Our room was wonderfully quiet and peaceful, but I did hear other guests complaining of noise - so make sure you ask for a room on the quiet side of the building.

Reviews.Title: “First class.”
Reviews.Author: oeyvin
Reviews.Content: Beste hotell i Istanbul. Super terasse med Fantastiske Utsikt .. Kort vei til alle interesante steder i den Historiske byen .. Frokost (inkludert) veldig bra. Servis veldig bra!. SIRI + OEYVIN. NORGE

Reviews.Title: “HOT HOT HOT!!”
Reviews.Author: HillaryReid87
Reviews.Content: Hotel Uyan, what a disaster! Upon arrival we discovered our room was not available so we had to stay in another room for one night. No biggie, but the next night they tried to place us in a basic room even though we paid for larger room. So after two days of switching rooms we finally get into the room we reserved only to find that the air conditioning was not working properly. This is not a problem in Istanbul in the winter but in May it can be quite hot. We spent the next 3 nights requesting something to be done about the air conditioning, and the staff seemed annoyed by this, stating that all their guests were hot, eventually they just put a small fan in our room. AVOID HOTEL UYAN!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Kind Service”
Reviews.Author: Mirweiss
Reviews.Content: When I ask something, they tried to do anything. Furthermore, they gave us wine w/ fruit basket as a gift for honeymoon trip. Recommended~!

Reviews.Title: “very close to Sultanahmet Mosque”
Reviews.Author: bostonrocker51
Reviews.Content: A lovely boutique hotel in the Sultanahmet district, near the Basilica Cistern, Ayasofya Mosque, Blue (Sultanahment) Mosque, and Topkapi Palace. Our room had a view of a flowering wisteria. The room rate of 130 Euro per night included a buffet breakfast, which was the same every morning. Breakfast was served on the 4th floor, which has rooftop terrace access, and great views of the Sea of Marmara and the Blue Mosque. The Blue Mosque has a very loud call to prayer around 5 AM each morning. I found it very distracting, loud, and hard to sleep through. The room was large, had a very comfortable king size bed, but trying to get a blanket instead of a down cover was not understood by the front desk. The hotel has wifi, not a string signal, but I had no problems connecting to the Internet. Oddly, Turkey does not allow YouTube, which has some good videos on basic Turkish.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent well-located small hotel, nice old building, comfortable rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MikeCoopermcc
Reviews.Content: Nicely decorated old building with character; rooms comfortable, light and airy, wooden floors and turkish rugs, good bathroom. Excellent location, just round the corner from Sultanahmet Square; on corner of quiet street near to main sights and to cafes and restaurants. Close-up views of Ayasofya and Blue Mosque from the roof terrace. Decent buffet breakfast. Friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Wendelfarb
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with two friends over New Year's Eve. The driver the hotel sent for us was rather late, but fortunately this was the only real negative (other than one somewhat clueless and/or lazy woman at the front desk during part of the stay). The desk attendant who checked us in was friendly. We had a triple, and were upgraded to the best room in the hotel according to the staff. The room was very clean and spacious, with lots of windows, plenty of closet space, a large tv and even a little vanity table and mirror for putting on makeup. The bathroom had a nice jacuzzi tub but could have used more lighting. The breakfast was just fine; plenty to eat and drink. The hotel does not let you bring in outside food, which we had wanted to do one night for dinner. Perhaps this is standard in such hotels though. There is even free internet available on a desktop computer on the top floor, which was a very nice amenity. The location is excellent, although the very long calls to prayer at the nearby mosques (longer than what I've heard living in other Muslim countries) can be a bit much when trying to sleep early in the morning! That said, it is really part of the charm of the cute neighborhood of painted wooden row houses.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kasens
Reviews.Content: Recently my husband and I stayed at Uyan Hotel while touring Istanbul. The location of the hotel is perfect- so close to Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, and Blue Mosque. We only took the tram once and that was to cross the bridge. We stayed in the standard room, which was quite snug, but was fine for us. We packed one suitcase for both of us, but if you have more luggage than that, then I recommend upgrading to a larger room. I am pretty sure our room used to be a linen closet :). Again, it was fine since we were out most of the time. I peaked at some other rooms and they had much more space and were lovely. The bathroom was clean and tidy, though, of course small. Breakfast was quite nice, though a couple of times we had to wait for a table. We also took our tea to the terrace upstairs with wonderful views. In the evenings, we purchased wine from the grocer down the street from Hagia Sofia and had that on the roof terrace. The staff were nice and accommodating. There were a few travelers whose rooms were not available due to over booking and the hotel put them in a similar hotel across the street. I think that this has happened before, but we were there over Easter holiday and all of Istanbul was quite crowded. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay and would visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service, good price”
Reviews.Author: happytravelereurope
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been recommended by a friend that has been there 3 times already. It is an excellent value for money. The location is great and the service also. So I really recommend if you are traveling with your familly or with a group of friends.

Reviews.Title: “Girls on Tour”
Reviews.Author: Angela6dublin
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time in this small but lovely hotel. Staff very friendly. In sultanamed which is old and full of culture. I left my gold necklace behind and they will forward it on to me by post. Honest in this day and age,

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: KayRegis
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to thoroughly recommend the Hotel Uyan. It is a gem of a hoel. Perfecly located within walking distance of many of the key tourist attractions. The hotel roof terrace enables you to sit and take in views of Aya Sofia, the Blue Mosque, the Sea of Marmara and the Bosphorus. It was wonderful to sit there, supping a glass of wine whilst listening to the call to prayer in the evenings. The staff are gentle, polite and thoughtful. Nothing was too much trouble. The breakfast was delicious - a real spread with enough variety to suit everyone's tastes. My room was comfortable, clean and tastefully decorated. In short - a wonderful hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great moderately priced hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: TheMarkS31
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a moderately priced, comfortable hotel in a convenient location in Istanbul. With that criteria, we were not disappointed. Our stay was primarily in low season, although our last couple nights switched to high season prices. At the low season prices, a standard room at Hotel Uyan is a fantastic value. At high season prices, itâ€™s not quite the bargain, though itâ€™s still fairly priced. The hotel is in the heart of Sultanahmet, so its location is definitely one of its advantages. Other perks are the rooftop views and the free breakfast. Itâ€™s not a luxury hotel by any stretch, but for a nice mid-range hotel, itâ€™s a fantastic choice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: pneggy
Reviews.Content: Amazing location, the Four Seasons hotel was just a stones throw away. A short 2 minute walk from the Cisterns, Blue Mosque, Sofia Church. Close to the tram. Very quiet side street. Great Value for Money. The rooms are a little on the small side, but really comfortable and clean. The breakfast is adequate, same old fare everyday, but I didn't really mind. One top tip is it is very close to some travel agents which offer very cheap transfer to and from the airport. We got conned and paid like 30 Lira each for transfer from the airport. But the journey back we booked with a agency called Aussie, it was only like 10 Lira for the journey back each. REAL bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MIqbal
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my partner to Turkey for the first time. Beautiful city. The hotel was ideally located for all the site seeing attractions and near the tram links. The staff were very polite and friendly (especially Muharam, Jana, Arzzu and Salli). The hotel is clean, comfortable and in the buzz of the city. Restaurants and cafes are all located near by. Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in the middle of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Dewi2010
Reviews.Content: I can only say what a delight it was to stay at the Hotel Uyan, which is located right in the heart of Sultanahmet. The hotel was spotlessly clean, the staff couldn't have been more helpful or friendly and the breakfast was super. I would thoroughly recommend staying here if you want to see the old historic part of Istanbul within 10 minutes walk of the hotel. I will certainly re-book this hotel on my next trip to Istanbul.... Much, much more to see that we couldn't cram into our weekend.

Reviews.Title: “heart warming”
Reviews.Author: allyz
Reviews.Content: Very close proximity to the blue mosque, i found a cozy little place. My flight was delayed 2 hours from London, almost midnight; I was amazed to find that the hotel transfers waited for me. I enjoyed the relaxed street setting petit hotel with a clean room and breakfast for an extremely generous rate. Superb concierge staff that helped me through some troubled times as well, The most touching part of my experience was the pristine architecture and history of Istanbul, still in awe form that... on my departure, I left some of my collectables at the hotel. I was heart sore since theses were for my kids and my nephews. I contacted Uyan and explained my loss and grief... I hoped and wished I had not left these behind... To my surprise the hotel staff and management posted the items at their cost and my experience had gone from history to personal and heartwarming. To care and love is by far a token of value priceless and this is by far more a reason I will return to Istanbul. mashAllah Iâ€™m inspired touched and content.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views, Good service, centrally located - not Bad nor Great”
Reviews.Author: lopezcotilla
Reviews.Content: Yes it has been a few years since I last stayed at this hotel. It is located in the famous heart of their eastern side of the city, close to the H. Sophia and the Blue Mosque, the Ottoman Palace -not far from the strait (that divided Europe from Asia) and the city's main tourist attractions. Located in a highly touristy area it may be more expensive than other options in less popular neighborhoods. Upon registering, what first struck me was the fascinating somber, deep and loud raspy Muslim "call to prayer" emanating from the Blue Mosque....at the front desk, they'll politely ask you to sit down "for a brief introduction" of the hotel. At first, I thought It was a nice touch, they'll serve you warm tea and cookies. However, after 30 minutes of being "introduced" to its services, after flying for 13 hrs - I was beyond antsy to get away from the reception lobby area and onto my bedroom. I politely cut off the lingering red carpet welcome and sped away. The rooms are nice, but pretty standard - clean, medium sized with a spartan version of the amenities we are used to in the US. i.e- tiny soap, shampoo, few large sized towels. Shower sprinkled water everywhere outside its limits, so be prepared to repeatedly ask for towels to dry up the pool of water waiting to be formed by the sink and toilet. it was a mess. Unfortunately, I did not ask for a room with a view, preferably of Istanbul's grand structures standing right before my nose, so make sure to insist for " a room facing the strait - the beds were comfortable and the pillows soft.
