However, given the hotel's location, in my room - it was brighter that expected at night with the curtains fully drawn. Not a big deal, but a bit annoying. DO NOT MISS having breakfast on the outside terrace overlooking the city's grand structures, it is by far breath taking and impressive. when out and about, I recommend you leave your bulky hotel key at the reception. If you need a cab, they'll call one for you - however, given the city's touristy location - they'll tend to overcharge. Make SURE to forcefully negotiate rate "before" hopping on, otherwise you will definitely be ripped off. When flagging a cab from downtown to hotel - follow the same mentioned rule - and don't be intimidated by Turks' often colorful, expressive mannerisms - they are not being rude. Rates are ALWAYS up for negotiation. (i.e- no timed meter anywhere)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and great room”
Reviews.Author: sokNsw
Reviews.Content: Hotel Uyan is situated in the Sultanahmet right next to the Blue Mosque. Efficient service and large light filled clean room. Breakfast on the roof top was stunning and staff helpful and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Dodlin
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at Hotel Uyan. The room (small single) was indeed on the smallish side, but otherwise it was clean and comfortable. The breakfast area is especially nice (and I imagine it's even better when it's not winter). Staff was welcoming and helpful. The hotel's location is excellent, it's only a couple of minutes' walk from Topkapi, Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque.

Reviews.Title: “"Excellent value, staff, and location"”
Reviews.Author: t_dkDenmark
Reviews.Content: We were instantly impressed with the warm welcome at the Uyan. This place was fabulous!With an incomparable view from the restaurant a top the hotel, Uyan Hotel is perfectly situated among the most significant historic landmarks.You will not find a better location. The hotel staff are excellent and most helpful. Of course we will stay again at the Uyan and would recommend it for absolutely everyone â€“ old, young, families, couples â€“ the staff is the best we have ever encountered in any hotel in the world.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel but dont take restaurant advice”
Reviews.Author: FREDDY023
Reviews.Content: Do not take advice on restaurants as the staff get a kickback and you will pay over the odds. We were ripped off. The location is brilliant, staff friendly and rooms clean. Also found this hotel to be great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A very good place to know Old Istambul by foot”
Reviews.Author: cpsimons
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for eight nights and had booked an upscale room. It was worth the price we paid for it. The room had two windows on the street - very quiet, taking into account the location - and it was better than what we had expected. The bathroom was on the same level. The normal rooms are also Ok, but quite smaller. The hotel lies two hundred meters from Hagia Sophia and also two hundred from the Blue Mosque. There are a lot of hotels in the area, but this one was one of the best. From the terrace you have an excellent view in all directions. The staff was not especially well trained, they spoke some english, but were not very friendly - perhaps they were shy because of their language problems.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent welcome and introduction to Turkey1”
Reviews.Author: work2wander
Reviews.Content: Welcomed at the airport to be driven to the hotel especially great when flying overnight and such a long flight at that. Large room with one double and one single bed. The most comfortable bed ever! Very nice young man at the desk but the girl the next day had no personality. Good breakfast and great to use the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful rude service, lying staff - STRESS”
Reviews.Author: frequenttriptaker
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have ever bothered to write a review but I feel so strongly about this awful hotel I fele I must warn you. Used it for 3 nights in November, check in was painful, was given the wrong room without an apology or explanation, tried to get one but the woman behind the desk was too busy answering the phone and dealing with someone else. The room given was tiny and not what we'd researhced or paid for. Room smelt, water pipes were loud and floor had not been cleaned, found hairs and public hairs on the bathroom towels. Asked for a room change and for one that was cleaned, was told there were none and with a 'smile' the receptionist said we could always try other hotels if we really wanted to....she was more or less telling us to 'pee off.' They c;laim to have a restaurant - they don't. It's never open and even if it was it only does sandwiches. Breakfast consitsed of dried fruit, fake juice that fizzed, hard bread and eggs left out for hours. The location of the hotel is good, but frankly, SO WHAT, Sulthanamet is a small very walkable place and is full of hotels so the locations of this hotel isn';t a factor. Booked our return shuttle with the hotel to the airport two days in advance. Stupidly we'd already paid. When the shuttle arrived 35 mins late we were in danger of not making it in good time as the traffic had really built up. The staff did nothing to hurry the van up, said they couldn;t get hold of the driver and 'hey', that's life' was they're attitude. We asked for a refund to out shuttle so we could get a taxi as we're were getting worried, no such luck. The shuttle finally turned up but the driver was rude and stank, the same as the hotel staff. Total rip off. On arrivaL and on cheking out we over heard other couples being moved fro rooms they'd booked so it wasn't a conincicdence that we wre all messed up - they clerarluy take bookings for specific rooms (each room has a different ptrice) and then place you wherever they want. STAY AWAY!!! There are LOADS of other great well mannered hotels in the immediate area. So some research and save yourself any stress.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: morinsky
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights prior to a cruise from Istambul. What a great location, walking distance to all major sites (Hagia Sofia, Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Bosphorus ..) From the terrasse where you have breakfast you are in the middle of the Blue Mosque and Hagia sofia we could not beleive the great location. Staff very nice. We reserved a regular room and got an upgrade to a Deluxe. Bathroom renovated and very clean. I would return to this hotel if ever in Istanbul. The taxi to the cruise ship is approx a 10 minutes ride. Lynne from Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a fantastic area of Istanbul for all the sights.”
Reviews.Author: HaheiWanderer
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel were really helpful.The rooms were quite roomy even tho we were in a standard room. The big plus is the hotels proximity to all the major sights in Sultanhamet---only a few minutes & easy walking.The breakfast is an excellent buffet & you have lovely views over the Sea of Mamaris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location great roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: unaontour
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little gem, it's in the centre of the old city, just a stones throw from the Blus mosque and lots of bars and resturants. The hotel also have a fantastic roof terrace with views of the mosque and the bosphorus. Just perfect. The rooms are a little on the small side, but when you're in Istanbul you're not going to be hanging around in your room watching CNN.

Reviews.Title: “Our New Extended Family at Uyan”
Reviews.Author: ramblinfan
Reviews.Content: We can't say enough wonderful things about the Uyan Hotel. As other members have mentioned, the location is absolutely ideal and the pick up at the airport made getting there a breeze. We had an infant, and the hotel staff was wonderful in meeting our every need, even rushing to put together a crib for us so that we could check in early and our baby could get a nap. In fact, four people were working to get our room ready quickly. The staff all welcomed the baby and came to play with her or hold her while we ate breakfast. We thought the breakfast was wonderful. The terrace had an incredible view as others have described, and our room was lovely and spacious (room 102). The bathroom was beautiful with a huge jacuzzi tub. This hotel is right next to the Four Season and, in our opinion, is Four Seasons quality without the expensive price. We would stay there again in a heartbeat. Tomorrow wouldn't be too soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in the Old Town”
Reviews.Author: Ataturkish
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Istanbul where 6 of us spent 2 nights at the Uyan Hotel. It is located within 5 min. walking distance (just like many other important landmarks) from the Blue Mosque, famous for being the only one with 6 minarets. The hotel owner owns a couple of businesses next door and is always present. The staff is extremely attentive and even the continental breakfast is good enough for an undemanding traveler keen on walking around the Old City without gorging in food. I highly recommend getting at least a deluxe room, as other options are just too small for Westerners.

Reviews.Title: “All around great spot - would return again anytime”
Reviews.Author: Canuckamuck
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, terrific service both at the front desk and the cafe - I'd recommend this to anyone looking for a comfortable hotel in the heart of Istanbul's Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great view from terrace, quiet, and good service”
Reviews.Author: Expat2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 4th floor, near the dining room. The room was quiet and clean, with very comfortable beds. Location is central in Sultanahmet but not noisy and the view from the terrace was very good (unobstructed view of Blue Mosque) The breakfast (included) had a nice selection. The staff were extremely helpful. We got a very reasonable deal through lastminute (67 euro for a twin room including breakfast).

Reviews.Title: “A great location and boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: CanadianIslanders
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights and when we had booked we had requested a balcony room, if at all possible. The first nice perk was if you booked directly with the hotel they arranged either a pick up or a drop off from the airport. We had arrived by cruise ship so the car picked us up right outside the terminal. We arrived at the hotel shortly after 9AM and we were so impressed that our room was ready - we had expected to be able to drop our bags but have to return much later to actually get to the room. Not only that, but they upgraded us to their "Blue Mosque" room as it had a balcony and there were none available for our category of room. The one side of the room was all windows and most opened as well as the patio door so we were able to really enjoy the sights and sounds from our room. The room was large and we looked directly across to the Blue Mosque and also see the water. We also had the big jacuzzi tub in the bathroom. The a/c worked great and was very quiet. We were on the fourth floor so just down the hall from the breakfast dining room. We almost missed the fact that there was a door leading to the roof and there are several tables up there to enjoy a great view and breeze while you eat. The view is great and you look one way to the Blue Mosque and the other to the Hagia Sophia. Also a view of the water. We also sat up there one evening and no one was there and we enjoyed a beautiful breeze. The hotel is a great location in the old city and minutes from the mosque, the palace, the cistern & about 15 minute walk to the Grand Bazaar or the tram is just minutes away. We ended up having the hotel arrange transport for us to the airport as it was an early flight and that was I believe EUR20. We got a good discount for paying cash for the room and we were actually ahead!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: justaguyNyc
Reviews.Content: I read mixed reviews on this place and the fact is that is is a cheap but fine hotel. Its more of a "Pension" than a hotel inside the room, the roomdeck is great, breakfast is included and fine, an it is smack in the middle of the Old City. Short walk to the ferries and Hamdi. Safe is small and air conditioning less than great but suffices. I got a small room and it is tiny, but sufficient. They rooms have safe's and there is wireless internet. So for the price no complaints. If you are transferring from the airport and the driver has trouble finding it tell him it is near the Four Seasons hotel. It is a bit noisy but anywhere in this area will be.

Reviews.Title: “If traveling to Istanbul for less than a month, it's by far the best choice.”
Reviews.Author: EastSideHighway
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel for a week while we attempted to immerse ourselves in the amazing history of Istanbul. For this reason alone, Hotel Uyan was an excellent decision. As opposed to a typical hotel, it is in a historical residence. Secondly, it is within waking distance of the most amazing architecture in Sultanahmet, the ferries at Eminonu, and a tram line that runs all the way from outside the old walls, through Beyoglu and out the other side. There are few places in Istanbul you cannot be within an hour from this hotel. In terms of the actual stay, our room was clean enough to perform open heart surgery in, and comfortable enough to make it hard to get up in the morning. When we finally did manage to escape from our beds in the morning, we were invariably provided with an excellent, healthy breakfast, and virtually anything else we asked for. This latter point is a crucial feature of the hotel: Both my friend and I agreed that the staff at this hotel were vastly superior to any we had ever stayed at. It seemed like they knew everything! How to get places, what would be safe and fun to do, you name it. I suppose that a wealthy tourist might prefer to stay at the intercontinental, or the four seasons which is directly adjacent. However, I can honestly say that if I were independently wealthy I wouldn't stay anywhere else. So if you are traveling to Istanbul, make sure to stay at Hotel Uyan, and give Canan and Salih upstairs a heads up. You'd be hard pressed to meet better people.

Reviews.Title: “Love the location & view”
Reviews.Author: az700609
Reviews.Content: My family had great time. The rooftop view was awsome. The place is clean, breakfast was the best to load yourself before starting long day. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “As good as we were told”
Reviews.Author: turbotoddi
Reviews.Content: We were recommended this hotel by family who had just been there. The hotel didnÂ´t disappoint us! ItÂ´s located just 400m from both the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia and in the middle of the old part of town (European side). The staff was one of the friendliest IÂ´ve ever met. The hotel offer free transfer to/from the airport (extra for Sabiha airport) when staying more than 3 nights. The hotel also has a great terrace like most houses in this part of town where you have a great view. The only two drawbacks with the hotel is that a small room is insanely small and that the breakfast was so and so. All in all and considering the price a fantastic buy.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: D1P1
Reviews.Content: When we booked this hotel, we were told it was a 4 star hotel - but it isn't. The hotel is in an excellent location, on a quiet street (for Istanbul) but very close to main tourist attractions. You can walk to pretty much every main thing to do. The hotel is very clean, and the rooms are well air conditioned. However, it is not 4 star. There is no room service - just drinks you can order to your room. The breakfast is passable. Not all the rooms have baths - just showers. No fluffy towels, robes, tea & coffee facilities or other little extras you expect in a 4 star hotel. The service is very mixed - one guy was very nice and one woman was very moody and the room service guy asked why we didn't use the mini bar (it was poorly stocked) . We got a great deal on the price - so if you get the right price, and you are looking for place to lay your head, then this is great. But if you're looking for relaxation, romance, a little luxary - its not the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel w/ a great location and great staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: ISTANBUL_LOVER09
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at Hotel Uyan in Istanbul. This visit was even nicer than the first. We loved the roof top terrace with views of the Blue Mosque, Haiga Sofia and the sea. The hotel rep., Mustafa, made our trip one to remember. He took care of all of our requests, gave us some great ideas and helped us to navigate easily around the city. He made our stay at Hotel Uyan wonderful!!! Johnny in Long Beach, CA

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: todaywewent
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine had recommended the Uyan to me and we booked it for our last night in Istanbul and it definitely exceeded my expectations. We stayed in a corner Blue Mosque room and it (as the name implies!) had an impressive view of both the Mosque on one side and the ocean on the other. It's not a super fancy, designer boutique hotel (nor does it claim to be!) but the decor was, for the most part, simple and everything seemed very clean. I actually really appreciated their motion sensors throughout - very environmentally friendly and energy efficient! The location of the hotel itself could not be better for site-seeing (Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Topkapi, etc). The staff was incredibly welcoming and helpful even though we arrived and left very late both nights. The breakfast buffet was generous and had both a lovely terrace and a rooftop eating area. All in all, it's a great hotel for the budget, a location that can't be beat, and a wonderful staff. We honestly couldn't have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: royalm
Reviews.Content: the hotel is a very central location and it is very near to the four seasons. you are able to take in the lovely views from the terrace at night or during the day. the hotel was very clean and the staff were very helpful when called upon. It is a stone throw away from all the main attraction and the tram is just 5mins away. The area is very nice and it gets very quiet in the evening after all the tourist departed the attractions. the only thing i would like to see this hotel improve on is its breakfast. Don't get me wrong it is very hearty and enough to feed a cow but for the 6 days we were there it did not change. it was the same thing every morning, just thought that we might have been served some thing different one morning. i am referring to hot meal. Apart for this bone of contention I have nothing but praise for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really Bad !”
Reviews.Author: mntravelerusa
Reviews.Content: It was a nightmare! We checked in - long process, shown to room (pre paid superior delux) the bellman had to keep waving his arm toward the hall light, which was on a motion sensor, to be able to see the keyhole to open the door and they forgot to give us keys - twice. Our superior delux room was tiny, damp and moldy -- beds were damp to the touch. The desk said we were listed for a std. room. As my sister is allergic to mold we insisted on another room. Again, the bellman had to wave continuously(a bit comical) in the hall to activate the light, this time the room was larger but the drapes were torn diagonally through the middle (blowing in the breeze) of the window, stains on the bed spreads, and you could not read in the room with all the lights on (one bedside lamp with two bed on the far sides of the room, no bedside table or light by the other bed). We decided to make the best of it and went out to dinner after emailing our travel agent since the hotel insisted on additional payment. Upon returning, the desk clerk and bellman came out from behind the desk and asked us why we emailed the agent (he was quite upset) and said that our room was just fine. We left after one night, unfortunately the rooms were very worn, tired and not very clean and the customer service was lacking. P.S. the breakfast was the worst we had in Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: hajralak
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 5 nights. The hotel was everything it promised to be and more. The location is ideal - within steps of The Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, and Topkapi Place. The staff was warm and welcoming and very helpful. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Views”
Reviews.Author: bctravels42
Reviews.Content: For a first time in Istanbul, Uyan was the perfect choice for exploring the Old City sights. Located right behind and between Aya Sofya and the Blue Mosque, it was easy walking distance to pretty much everything you'd want to explore, including Topkapi Palace, Basilica Cistern and the Grand Bazar. The Spice Market was a bit further (about 20 minutes) but you could also easily take the tram one or both ways. Given the location, we either walked or took the tram everywhere we wanted to go, including down to the harbour for the bosphorous boat cruise and a trip out to Princes' Islands. We had Room 309 (Deluxe) which faced the back of the hotel. This turned out to be a good thing as it was pretty quiet (other than during the call to prayer, which given the closeness to the Blue Mosque was loud), overlooked some green space, stayed cool (despite 30 degree weather) and was definitely a good size, especially the tub/shower. The wiresless internet connection was very good and available 24/7. One small complaint was that the room, although clean, could use some upkeep as there was paint peeling off the wall above the bed. As I'd read previously on Tripadvisor, the views from the breakfast terrace were fantastic. The breakfast itself was the most basic of the three hotels we stayed at in Turkey (Pera Tulip in Beyoglu and Kelebek in Goreme were the other two), but was good enough for us. The various breads and cheeses offered were particularly good. All things considered, we enjoyed the Uyan for its location and great views. It was a very good hotel for our first trip to Istanbul and we would particularly recommend it for other "first timers".

Reviews.Title: “An ideal place to stay in Istanbul location-wise and most likely the best rooftop view in the city”
Reviews.Author: Lomamielessa
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Uyan with my husband for four nights in May 2009. Definite value for money in terms of location and overall services (including a very satisfactory breakfast). The view from the rooftop terrace is fantastic - you face not only the sea and the old town, but both Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque. The latter two (plus Topkapi palace and many more sights) are right behind the corner so the location is perfect for sightseeing by foot, and also surrounded by many nice restaurants (try Rami on the same street!). The rooms are small, but on the other hand, one comes here for seeing the city. Ask for a balcony room if available (e.g. 303). Would absolutely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: Mitzie14
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent several days at the Uyan Hotel and found the accommodations clean and pleasant. The hotel staff was supportive of all requests. Wonderful roof top view, good location and ample breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “quiet and central location, lovely roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: Zizzahadi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and liked the place a lot. Sultanahmet is very quiet compared to the Istikal Cadesi area where we stayed a few days later. Actually we liked this area better. The hotel is just between the two mosques en close to the bazar. It is clean and breakfast was fine. The roof terrace has a wonderful view. We had dinner in the neighbourhood at restaurant Sofa, very friendly people and nice food.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, friendly, comfortable and very, very convenient”
Reviews.Author: Achillea
Reviews.Content: It's hard to imagine a better place to stay to see major sites, especially if your time in Istanbul, like ours, is too brief (we had fout nights and three days in the City). The hotel combines old Turkish charm with a "western" level of comfort--good bed, lots of space, minibar, free wi-fi in the room, and, in our room, a jacuzzi tub. The staff is very friendly. A three-day or more stay earns you a free ride in from the airport. The breakfast is extensive and excellent. But the main selling point is location, location, location. The building is just steps from Hagia Sophia, the Topkaki Palace, and the not-to-be missed archeological museum, and a couple of blocks from the Blue Mosque. The Arasta Bazaar, small but with high quality goods, is a block away and it contains an impressive museum of mosaic remains from Constantine's palace. The Grand Bazaar is within walking distance, or you can take the tram and walk less. The location of the hotel enables you to get all the "must see" sites under your belt and leaves time for something different: St. Saviour in Chora if you dig mosaics, Iskitlal Caddesi and the Beyoglu district for the European facet of Istanbul...there is so much.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: cantjump
Reviews.Content: We had an outstanding experience at Hotel Uyan. The location in Sultanhamet, literally just steps from the Hagia Sofia and Blue Mosque, is outstanding. The surrounding area has a good variety of restaurants and shops. Although the area is very tourist-oriented, to say the least, we got good meals in the area at a reasonable price. THe hotel is recently renovated and very clean. The service staff is friendly and helpful. When we arrived the room we had booked for 3 people seemed a little small. For 20 euros additional we relocated to a larger room, which better served our needs. The staff was very helpful in making the transition, although we were probably lucky it was off-season and we had the option to switch. The bathroom was modern and clean. The T V was quality with a good selection of international cable offerings. The breakfast room is located on the top floor and the offerings were plentiful, healthy and fresh. Good bread, cheese, fruit, vegetables, cereals and couple of hot offerings. Although the weather was poor for most of our stay I still made several trips to the roof deck which has great views of the surrounding area, including the Bosphorus. The Uyan offers a free transfer from the Airport if you stay more than 3 nights and that worked out perfectly for us. All of this was very reasonably priced. I would highly recommend this hotel to almost any type of traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Gem”
Reviews.Author: Jaqui2001
Reviews.Content: Hotel Uyan staff were so welcoming and helpful. We traveled to Istanbul in December, between Christmas and New Year's. Our room was always cozy and warm. The room and bathroom were lovely and always clean. There is a small rooftop terrace with a terrific view of the Blue Mosque -- which was breathtaking on New Year's Eve. Breakfast offered a variety of dried fruit, various kinds of bread, butter, honey, jam, cheese, delicious yogurt, olives, cereal, hard and soft boiled eggs, juice, coffee and tea. Staff helped us get around and suggested routes and sights to see. Mustapha, who worked at the front desk, was especially welcoming and helpful. All staff worked hard to make sure all guests were comfortable. There is a computer for guest use and a router to provide internet access for guests with laptops. It was a pleasure to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “shabbily-maintained hotel”
Reviews.Author: absolute_alex
Reviews.Content: This is one of those boutique hotels which could have been fabulous, but fell so far short. I booked a standard room and the first impression upon arrival was great -- the lobby was done up charmingly in an English library way, with comfortable looking sofas and carpets. The front desk personnel, a young man whose name I don't recall being mentioned, was warm, friendly and helpful. The hotel has a beautiful spiral stairwell that led up to the rooms (also an elevator). But it was downhill the moment I got to the room. I was placed in room 203. The room itself was not too bad looking, it was a corner room with a balcony. But it had no double-glazed window and was noisy -- you could hear the street noise, cars and trucks passing, etc. The curtains were really thin, so the room remained bright when one turned off the lights to turn in for the night. The pillows were quite lumpy and the lighting was really dim, it was hard to read by the lights. Luckily, the mattress was not in as dire a state as the pillows. The bathroom was adequately sized but badly maintained. There was mold in the grout, which really put me off. The shower leaked too, soaking up the bath mat every time I took a shower. I started to understand why the bathroom was in such a horrid state -- the housekeeping crew really did a lousy job. The hardwood floors were not vacuumed/ mopped daily, I could see dirt on the floor, such as hair. (I had booked for 4 nights and had no choice but to stay on. It was also busy and I could not switch rooms without upgrading to a more expensive "deluxe" room). Surfaces like the tables in the room were not wiped down. The only things they seemed to do was make the bed and change the towels. Even the bathroom counter wasn't cleaned. This hotel could have been great, the staff were friendly, the location of the property unbeatable (in the Sultan Ahmet historic area), and the property itself was formerly a lovely home. But since the upkeep and maintenance weren't there, it really dragged down the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Better Options Out There”
Reviews.Author: CtotheG
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 3 nights in Istanbul. The hotel had been recommended by colleagues who had previously stayed there. As there are a lot of boutique hotels in the area, we wanted to go with something with a recommendation. Plusses: The hotel is clean, in a great neighborhood with easy access to all of the sights, public transportation, etc. We had a superior room, which had a large bathroom with a jacuzzi tub. Breakfast had a decent selection of breads, cereals, etc. With 3 nights stay we were met at the airport and driven to the hotel, which was nice after a long flight. Minuses: The rooms are dull, sparsely furnished (no clock, dresser), with uncomfortable beds. Our room was on the first floor near the front desk, so we were treated to noise from other guests, as well as street noise. The cleaners also left our windows open all day, so after a long day of sightseeing in the rain, we were treated to a freezing cold room. The bathroom had paint was flaking off the ceiling and the towels provided were thin and ratty, like something you'd find at a cheap motel. Upon check-in we also were accosted with 'recommendations' of tours and restaurants. When asked about local restaurants, the clerk said she could only recommend the earlier one. We loved Istanbul and this hotel was fine, however, we'd be willing to try somewhere new- probably the Empress Zoe. While having a driver from the airport was convenient, we found the public transportation to Sultanahmet easy and very cheap (less than 2 euro per person).

Reviews.Title: “Could have been a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in very good location, near all the sites in the old city and transportation to outside of the old city. The breakfast is very good, the luggage person is very helpful. However, to be comfortable, you need to stay at the de luxe room at a higher floor, though, the light has very low wattage. The standard room is very uncomfortable, small, facing the street hence noisy early morning until evening. The bathroom though clean is very, very small. The lady receptionist seemed to be very interested in selling you tours (I am sure she gets commission) and once you decline she lost interest to deal with you. Hearing about fraud in taxi charges, we took a taxi called by the hotel but still, we were charged almost double!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but beware Room 102!”
Reviews.Author: Meananean
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews and the proximity to the action. It was in a quiet street and very close to the posh Four Seasons.Hotel. We were met at the airport which is a relief in a foreign bustling environment. The reception staff were competent in English and check-in was hassle free. My only gripe was that we were put in a deluxe room '102' which is very near the front desk. For a start it was a dark,dreary room with the dulled light coming in from two windows which opened onto a high wall. Worse was to come when we went to bed for the night, the constant noise from people coming and going through the front foyer until the wee hours of the morning ensured that I didn't get to sleep until well after 3.00am. The cavenous stairway and foyer amplified the noise, so that I felt we were sleeping just inside the front door. I complained next morning and requested another room. I am not sure if this would have been accepted had I not said that we were willing to go up a notch to the 'super deluxe room' at an extra 10 euro. Our next few nights were very peaceful and our mood improved considerably. The breakfast was fairly good, but I would like to see some real muesli (without the choc-chips) included on the menu and possibly have access to the coffee and tea making facilities continue all day as you cant drink the water.There is a wonderful roof-top area for breakfast, but it seems that the staff thought it was too cold for eating there now as all the chairs and tables were put away. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and recommend it to others. I think it was okay value for money, though our friends who stayed in a standard room, had little room to move and the table chairs and toilet were very low to the ground.

Reviews.Title: “Uyan a Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: CA-Tweety
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel out of the blue and it was a real find! We stayed for 7 nights in a room on the first floor overlooking the street, and it was amazingly quiet (even the Call to Prayer didn't wake us in the early a.m.). The staff were all extremely helpful and friendly. The bathroom was clean and pleasant, and there was a hair dryer. The breakfast was fantastic: a spread with delicious melons/fruit, eggs, fresh cucumbers/tomatoes, black and green olives, yogurt, simit and other breads, cereals: really fresh, tasty, healthy. You could eat inside in air-conditioned comfort or outside with a view of Aya Sofya, the Blue Mosque, and the Sea of Marmara. (Worth a visit at night with a bottle of wine!) The location is a stone's throw from all sorts of tourist destinations, and the price was quite reasonable (with a discount for cash payment). I would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable with a great location”
Reviews.Author: sacrifice
Reviews.Content: Uyan is just off the exciting part of Istanbul - you can easily reach and see the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia, etc. The rooms are large and very comfortable. If your arm was twisted the only negative would be a lack of a friendly face at the front desk while we were there. I know that we were responsible for the language barrier but there also appeared to be an attitude barrier. However, it is unreasonable to judge a hotel on one staff member.

Reviews.Title: “Uyan Hotel well located”
Reviews.Author: PennyT117
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed 4 nights in mid June and were pleased with the hotel.It is well located for all the sights and is situated in a quiet street.The rooms are clean and well presented and the bathrooms are excellent.The transfer from the airport by the hotel went smoothly.The breakfast was adequate and similar to others we had in Turkey and the view from the rooftop was amazing.The only problem we encountered was when I asked reception for information regarding the public ferry trips up the Bospherous.I was told that they no longer operated and I should book the trip with SHE tours which they could help me with.Needless to say, the public ferry operates regularly and is only Euro 5 whereas the SHE tour was quoted at Euro 25.I was disappointed with the blatant attempt to mislead us regarding the ferries. Overall I would recommend the hotel with the proviso to look elsewhere for unbiased sightseeing advice!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: crre
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Uyan for a long weekend in early July. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. We took a deluxe room, which was huge, clean, tastefully decorated and comfortable. We were met at the airport by the hotel driver, a great treat. This hotel is in an amazing location, very close to the Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque and the Topkapi Palace. Take a left out of the hotel to get to them, take a right and you are in a quaint neighborhood full of sidewalk cafes and a mini-bazaar. The Grand Bazaar and Spice Bazaar are also within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: oateydog
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in excellent location. Very clean, quiet, comfortable and accomodating. Hotel picked us up from the airport effortously and on time - an added bonus since we arrived close to midnight. Nice breakfast and helpful staff. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Keliautoja
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Uyan hotel for a few nights in September and it was indeed a lovely stay. The location for sightseeing can't be better. They serve breakfast on the roof of the hotel and the view was just breathtaking. I got my pick up (which was for free if you stay over three nights) and drop off at the airport and service was excellent. I had some additional requests and they were providing everything. I really don't have anything negative to say. If you would be staying for longer, maybe breakfast could have been more diverse and even when rooms and everything were great, I guess their photos on the website are a little bit more sleek than in reality.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but be weary”
Reviews.Author: benscott03
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Uyan in mid-November. The taxi driver had a hard time finding it, but after asking a few people on the street, we arrived. We got there fairly late, and the manager was very friendly and accomodating. He brought us water and checked us in. The hotel is very quaint and on a nice little street near the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. It is also close by to the tram and within walking distance to the Grand Bazaar (10 mins). Our room was on the second floor of the 4 floor building. It was clean, old, slightly smelly. The TV worked by pressing the #6. Overall, for the money, I would say it is a good deal. Breakfast in the morning is good - fresh bread, cheese, juice, coffee. The view from the terrace is incredible. Every morning you will get a wake up call from the mosque around 6am. That at first was shocking, but we got used to it. If we went back to Istanbul, we would probably stay there again. But this time, I would make sure to be more assertive with the desk clerk. A few words of warning about the hotel and Istanbul: When checking in, the manager pulled out a map and showed us where we were and where the main attractions were. When I checked out, he charged me for the map! He never asked me if I wanted a map. Second, they have a nice trick in Istanbul, and I was sadly upset to see the manager pulled it on us. Unfortunately, Istanbul uses both the Turkish Lira and the Euro. They tend to quote prices in Lira and then charge Euros (about 40-50% higher). The manager arranged a car to take us to the airport and said it would cost 20 Lira. When we got there, the guy charged us 20 Euro. This was typical there, and you MUST be careful. Also, the hotel offered us help with some sightseeing tours. We took one that went down the Bosphorus and to the Spice Market with SHE tours. This was a TOTAL waste of money. We could have gotten in a taxi and gone down to the Spice Market and walked around on our own and then gotten on a fairy for one quarter of the cost. The guide offered no colorful info at all. ALSO, do not believe a merchant when they tell you that you can go to the local post office and buy a nice thick box to send your things that you purchase home in. We bought some nice Turkish plates, and were told that we could send our things home through the post. (We were also told this about a rug we purchased). First of all, the post does NOT sell boxes. Secondly, you can only ship things max 5kg. SO, always have the merchant ship for you. Believe me, it will save you a huge headache and a lot of money. When bargaining in Istanbul, immediately cut the price in half and always make sure you understand that the currency they are bargaining in is Lira.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bos2677
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Uyan is a botique hotel located between the Hagia Sophia and the Blue mosque. It is half a block away from the Four Seasons Hotel. The lobby and rooms were extremely clean. The hotel has a lift for those who need help getting up to the 4th floor for breakfast. The breakfast was a typical continental one with fresh meat, cheese, fruit, yogurt, cereal, toast, and good coffee. You can sit in the breakfast room and gaze at the Blue Mosque while you eat. We were there in November so we did not sit on the roof terrace, but the view up there is spectacular of the Blue Mosque and the Bhosporus. The room was larger than I expected with a full size bed and wood floors. The bathroom was also larger than you usually find in Europe with a glass enclosed full size tub-shower. They also have an Internet room with one terminal for free use by any guest, and also wireless throughout the building. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Map_Reading
Reviews.Content: Hotel Uyan is a small family run business located in a quiet street between the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. The top historic sites and the ferry port and station are all within walking distance. The hotel's decor is tasteful, and the breakfast terrace at the top of the building has some stunning views. The hotel does not serve food apart from the help yourself breakfast, but cafes and restaurants were within easy reach. Staff were friendly and helpful - Excellent base for a short city break. Expect to be 'called to prayer' early in the morning - from the speakers on the Blue Mosque! Mrs O, Reading, UK

Reviews.Title: “Not a pleasant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SydneyBel
Reviews.Content: Arriving into the hotel at 9.30pm, the guy who helped me up with the luggage opened the door into the room and the NOISE was just incredible. From a bar on the street, you could here the really bad singer as though they were in the room - when I mentioned the level of noise the guy says 'it only goes til 1am' - oh and great advice - don't open the (not double glazed) doors. I went downstairs and asked to change rooms but they were 'full' so went back to the room and had a look around and was really disappointed. It was very small - I had paid for a 'not small room', the bathroom was clean but I can't say the same for the sheets that were grey and stained - could have been clean but who wants to sleep on stained sheets and the pillows were like lumpy porridge - def past their use by date The curtains didn't cover the windows so the bright lights seeped around the edges. OK so the really loud singing noise did stop around 12.30am but then the guests clatter back to their rooms on the tiled common areas and the garbage truck shows up at 2am They knew I wanted to change rooms but nothing was mentioned when I saw the night staff member in the hotel the next morning - I was due to stay 5 nights but packed up and went to reception and let them know what was the problem and that I wanted to leave - the guy was rude - dismissive and soooo arrogant as he waved his hand to get rid of me. There are PLENTY of hotels to stay in - and this hotel offers nothing in the way of value for money - you can do better than staying here- I stayed in Taksim after this and thoroughly enjoyed my hotel stay there - chalk and cheese

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place for a nice stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Visitorfromholland
Reviews.Content: With my husband I stayed six nights in the Uyan in the middle of october. We booked via the hotel's website and the communication was ok. There was a driver to pick us up at the airport as promised. The room was very clean, a very good bed, a good bathroom and shower and is nice decorated. The hotel is situated in a quit neighbourhood, so hardly any noice from traffic. I read some complaints about the mosque callings early in the morning, but in my experience you can't find a hotel in Istanbul (or any city in Turkey) where you don't hear that. The neighbourhood well equiped for tourists and all the famous sightseeing objects are round the corner. The staff is very friendly and helpfull (reservations, taxi's etc). The breakfast is good quality turkish, it offers fresh goods and a choice for everyone. When I come back in Istanbul I certainly go back to the Uyan.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay at Uyan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eiland
Reviews.Content: With two friends I have stayed for 4 nights in the Uyan Hotel. We have very much enjoyed our stay, and I have never before experienced such friendly and helpful staff of the hotel! They entertained us with charming stories about Turkey and helped us with reserving restaurants, etc. Apart from this friendly atmosphere, our room was very charming and clean. The furniture and decoration of the hotel is tasteful and the view from the rooftop terrace is amazing with a view over the Blue Mosque, the Aya Sophia and the Golden Horn. Further, the Uyan Hotel is very favourably located in a nice and safe neighbourhood in the old city centre right at the foot of the Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia and Topkapi Palace. This location is great for sight seeing. I would recommend everyone planning a trip to Istanbul to stay at the Uyan Hotel, this really adds value to your stay! Kind regards, (Ms) Tessel Mellema The Netherlands (Amsterdam)

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: creativeillusion
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent â€“ within walking distance to almost everything. The staff was friendly and helpful, offering advice, maps, and arrangements to the airport. Our double room was very clean and quiet. It offered a flat screen TV, a safe (for our passports, etc.), and more. The breakfast buffet was ample with coffee, tea, cereals, eggs, bread, meat, cheese, cakes, and more, which you can eat on the terrace with a GREAT view. They offer a discount if you pay in cash. They except both Euros and Turkish Lira, which is great since we came from Greece with extra Euros in our pocket. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: FlyingRussian
Reviews.Content: We spent very little time at the room - as usually in Istambul - but we are shure that it was the best place to stay here. Actually honeymoon suite was not such comfortable - with direct view on the Sultan Ahmet Mosque and early 5 AM wake-up ))) And this is NO real bar or restaurant on the rooftop by night - so we used the neighbour reastaurant Seven Hills. But surroundings, closeness to everything and good beds are worth the price. The owner/general manager and staff are VERY friendly. Ramazan is not the best time to come here, with more locals on the area, additioning crowds of holidaymakers - but next time we will recommend our friends to stay just here - at least at this street.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: thumper9
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. On arrival we upgraded to what they call the "Honeymoon suite". We stayed for five nights. The room was large with a small patio and a great panoramic view. The bathroom had a slight sewer smell....after a couple of days we discovered if we put the wastebasket over the floor drain it stopped the odor. The staff was helpful but not overly so......the young girl at the reception was very friendly, spoke good English, but she really couldn't answer many of the usual tourist questions. Free internet, free pickup at the airport and a good breakfast on the roof with a great view of the Blue Mosque. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.....although I would probably opt for one of the less expensive rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: attaqnia
Reviews.Content: I have stayed with my family for more than one week in delux rooms. The hotel is very nice, quite and clean. The location is perfect in the historical area SultanAhmet near all the historical famous places. Finally the hotel staff is very cooperative, the manamgment and the other staff serving the breakfast. We realy enjoyed our saty.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in this Turkish Delight”
Reviews.Author: illuminatus
Reviews.Content: Two days after I got married my wife and I arrived in Istanbul and we stayed at this excellent hotel. I had been very concerned by some negative reviews on the website but once I arrived my fears were put to rest. The staff were obliging and helpful and almost all understood enough English to get by. The location, as has already been pointed out, was fantastic. The breakfast was very tasty and prepared you for a long day out sightseeing.... and the view from the terraces provided me with the best photos from the entire journey. We stayed in the Honeymoon Suite which was very spacious and yet cozy at the same time. Soft lighting, and a view of the SultanAhmed Mosque that defied belief... All in all, a very nice hotel and one which we hope to visit again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable hotel”
Reviews.Author: rplaier
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Uyan Hotel in Istanbul. It is perfectly located for sightseeing in the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul. Apart from the excellent location, the staff was friendly and our room was spacious and tidy. The hotel sent a driver to the airport to meet us. I would recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small Hotel in top location”
Reviews.Author: Kribbl_Markus
Reviews.Content: We spend 6 days in Istanbul and stayed in the nice and small Hotel Uyan in the Sultanahmet district (old city) of Istanbul. The Hotel is located in a quiet street only 500 meters away from both the Blue Mosque, the famous Hagia Sofia and the Topkapi Palace (Palace of the Sultans of the Osmanian Empire). The Hotel is a nicely refurbished townhouse where the careful and nice renovation style meets today's functionality. This means: very nicely decorated clean rooms with bathroom at the same time also featuring A/C and Wifi. There is also a Web Terminal at the top floor. But the best feature is on the top: a roof terrace with a magnificient view on the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sofia and the Marmara See and parts of the town. You can have breakfeast and drinks on the roof terrace, but there is no restaurant in the Hotel - but this does not really matter as there is a wide choice of Restaurants (indoor and outdoor) close to the Hotel (starting next door) and this also means that the Uyan Hotel is a quiet place. The reception is very helpful (and knowledgeable) and can assist you in English - they even had an umbrella to offer when we were surprised by rain. If you want to go further by public transport, there is a stop of the very new (A/C) tram about 700 m away (you could even take that to the Airport). One little point to mention: as the Hotel is very close to the Blue Mosque, be aware that the prayer announcement of the Muezzin at sunrise will let you know to start the day... So: if you are looking for a decent, individual, clean and very nice hotel with a magnificient view, go for the Uyan.

Reviews.Title: “In the Heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Guajiro46
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Uyan is a fabulous mid-sized hotel in the center of the most desirable area of Istanbul. I stayed for one week this June and couldn't have asked for a more ideal experience. My room was spacious, very clean, and had a great Turkish flair. Climbing the steps onto the roof-top terrace you'll be swept off your feet by the stunning views of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, and the Bosphorous Strait, all within a two minute walk. The hotel staff was very helpful in planning the day trips that I wanted to take, and always suggested fabulous restaurants for dinner. I highly recommend the Hotel Uyan for anyone planning a visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the $$$$”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugsToronto
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on fairly good reviews on trip advisor. It also fell into the top end of our price range which has always gotten us a good room in a nice hotel. (We have used this website for booking hotels with success on several occasions) one of the comments on the website was about the call to prayer which we fully expected. Having visited a number of middle eastern countries we are used to it. Nothing prepared us, however, for the incredible sound coming at us at 4:30 in the morning. We expected the windows to be fully sealed, they are not, and you should all be aware that you will hear the entire call to prayer as if it was being delivered outside your window. We arrived late (expected) and the desk manager was friendly and helpful. Our room was spacious and clean although the decor screamed the 1950s (serioulsy right out of some weird movie). However, the location was good so we were very pleased. Upon arrival we were given a brochure for day trips in and around the city. When we checked with the desk clerk about these he gave us a different brochure telling us IT was a better company. The prices were the same so we tried to book two tours. One was of the Asian side of Istanbul and the other to Bursa. The first tour was no problem. The day desk clerk told us the second might not go, but it should be okay, she would call back within the hour and let us know.... We had to keep after her for TWO days and kept suggesting that we find another tour if that wasn't going to be held. Finally, when it was too late to get another tour she told us the trip to Bursa was cancelled and she actually said there were no tours at all being held anymore for the following day (does that sound credible to you? I didn't think so) . Needless to say we were disappointed. The only thing they were excited about booking us into was the show at the Galata Tower, which as it turns out they get a commision for. Although the performance was fun, it is absolutely not worth the price and the food make us sick. We ate at many other restaurants and we were fine. Also, after the first few days the maid stopped fully cleaning the room. Glasses we had used were left uncleaned on the counter where we left them and some powered sugar that spilled on a table when opening some Turkish Delight sat there for two days. She also did not change the sheets and only sporadically refilled the mini-bar. Basically, all she did was make the bed and change the towels. Upon check-out we tried to pay for our mini-bar bill and our car to the airport with credit card. Apparently they don't take credit cards!!??!! We gave cash and asked for an itemized bill since it seemed to be a little high and we weren't sure how much we had actually used. The clerk said she didn't have a bill but would prepare one for us to have when we returned to pick up the car for the airport. I'm sure nobody is surprised that there was no bill waiting for us when we got back to the hotel. We didn't get a chance to ask for it because we were making sure that our luggage (which had sat in their lobby under the watchful? eye of the clerk all day) was intact and present. Ironically enough while we were riding the airport they called the driver to see if he picked up an extra bag because one had gone missing from the lobby. We are 85% sure we were overcharged on the final bill but were so glad to leave the hotel it was worth it. Does this sound like a rant? Yes it does! Take my advice and don't stay at this hotel. Rudy and Chris - Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, spotless -- loved Uyan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grizela
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at the end on a cobblestoned little street that has been voted the prettiest street in Istanbul for the past few years. It is literally around the corner from the Blue Mosque and Hajia Sophia, and a small bazaar with better prices than the Grand Bazaar. BTW, it sits diagonally from the Four Seasons, which has terrible street views on 2 sides and is surrounded by noise. On this smaller street, all was quiet at night. The staff was considerate and always ready to help with any question, from restaurant ideas to sites to visit. We were a party of four, in two rooms. Both were spotless! The bathrooms were spotless! The beds were comfy. Our windows opened onto the back, so at night we had a flower-covered wall and trees behind us. Our stay was May 15 and 16, and we cannot wait to go back and stay with them again. TripAdvisor helped me find this hotel, so thanks to all who sent in previous reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Convenient and Charming”
Reviews.Author: slyblue
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Uyan Hotel for 4 days in late November, 2006. Having read other reviews, I had my concerns. But, I must agree with those who had a very pleasant stay (and these folks seem to be in the majority). I was met at the airport as agreed. I was placed on the third floor in a Deluxe room with a king-sized bed, just as I reserved. There were no offensive smells or noises. On the contrary, the hardwood floors and bathroom tiles were gleaming, the bed was comfortable and everything worked properly. The breakfast served in the 4th floor breakfast room was not elaborate, but the food was fresh and plentiful. The other guests I observed also seemed to be enjoying their stay. I found all of the front desk personnel to be very helpful, especially Osman. As others have noted, the location is excellent for sightseeing. Most tourists sites in Sultanahmet are within walking distance. In short, I cannot think of anything that the hotel could have done to improve my stay. It was a very enjoyable vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for the sea view rooms on 4th floor”
Reviews.Author: savvychic-travels
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 4 nights in July 2006 and we had the opposite experience of the last two reviewers. The driver not only met me at the airport but when I mentioned that I liked to fish, he drove me through the fish market on the way to the hotel so I could see the fresh catch that morning. He'd slow down and shout out to people in Turkish, "hey how much for that one?" and then he'd tell me in a very animated voice how expensive a bass or flounder-type fish was as I hung out the car window gawking at the stands. Our standard room on the 4th floor (401 or 403?) was flooded with light and very lovely with a view of the water in the distance. These rooms on the higher floors are not the "deluxe" renovated rooms and so were fairly inexpensive -- IIRC we paid 82 Euro after the cash discount (we booked directly through the hotel website) and had two twin beds. We were also offered the cute room next to us which had a tiny and very cute balcony -- that room only had one double bed, however, so we couldn't take it. I'd suggest you ask for the room with the balcony and sea view if you're a couple. Loved the hardwood floors in these rooms and the bathrooom looked newly tiled and was immaculate although there was a moldy smell that wouldn't go away. A/C/ worked great and there was a mini-bar fridge with room for our drinks and fruit. Service was relatively efficient and very friendly -- personally greeted in the mornings and afternoons by the hotel owner's son who did much of the renovation. The staff in the morning breakfast room were very accomodating and made us turkish coffee in the mornings when they saw we didn't enjoy the watered-down American coffee. Staff chatted with us on a daily basis about our plans and answered all our questions and they were happy to store our luggage on the day of check-out and even put our laptops in a locked office when we voiced worries about leaving our luggage behind. The rooftop is as beautiful as it looks on their website and like everyone else says, location is very central and their buffet breakfast is very good with many options. Sorry and surprised to hear that people had problems with service -- was it one particular person you were dealing with? The older front desk guy was friendly and efficient, the younger guy who took our luggage up was also very friendly and jovial but didn't seem able to do much about our concerns with the mold smell in the bathrooom -- he said it would air out if we kept the fan on. Overall, we had a great time here and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “poor cutomer care”
Reviews.Author: starjohnday
Reviews.Content: We booked a 4 night stay at the Uyan hotel in October through Venere and after arranging the complimentary shuttle service from the airport to the hotel (by Email and confirming by phone) we where disappointed to find nobody at the airport to meet us, after locating a phone and waiting a further 1/2 hour we where eventually picked up. The room (205) we were assigned was the standard Deluxe which was clean and tidy even though there was no satellite reception to the TV. We complained about this and I believe as a token gesture the bell boy was sent to our room to say that they would get a tecnichen up to our room to fix it. As an ex TV engineer I could see that the room was not wired for Satellite and that the bell boy was sent to ''placate the tourists''. In view of this lack of customer care and having no faith that my complaint/issue would be resolved I could not be bothered to report the shower tray that constantly leaked and took 10 minutes to drain. In my mails and confirmation calls to the hotel I had made it known that the trip was both a wedding anniversary and birthday celebration in the hope that the hotel would at least place some flowers in our room (which I would have been happy to pay for) but no that was obviously too much to ask for. The only positive I can add to this review is that the location of this hotel is perfect for the sights and the breakfast is to a good standard; just don't expect good customer care.

Reviews.Title: “Poor, poor staff”
Reviews.Author: fromdenile
Reviews.Content: We were booked to stay at the Uyan Hotel for 6 nights in early October. At check-in, we were shown to a dark, dreary room totally surrounded by high walls. When we requested a room change, we were told we would be able to move the following morning, which satisfied us. The next morning, we asked about the change and were then told it would be impossible (even though we had 5 nights remaining) as they were fully booked. At the time of this conversation, two separate couples were waiting to check out. When I told the Uyan staff that we would have to find other accomodations if they were unable to change our room, they just shrugged their shoulders. I then walked next door to the Seven Hills Hotel and was given a wonderful room with an outdoor balcony for the same price. I would not recommend the Uyan to anyone, although I highly recommend the Seven Hills, both for the quality of the accomodation and the high degree of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Charming but hopeless”
Reviews.Author: andrew171
Reviews.Content: We were astonished to read some of the effusive reviews below as we do not recognise the hotel we stayed at from these. First some positive points - The Uyan is in an excellent location, right in the centre and commanding excellent views of the Blue Mosque from the roof terrace. It also benefits from beiÄ±ng very close to the Four Seasons Hotel which has bars and restaurants that are open. The staff at the hotel were generally friendly and charming although this could not make up for their general lack of competence and experience. The rooms were newly (though very simply) furnished and the bathrooms were new and very clean. After booking and prepaying our room in advance through Expedia. we were dumbfounded to be told on arrival that the hotel was full and that we would be staying in the inferior hotel next door. Having made clear that we were not prepared to stay next door the manager suggested that our friends, due to arrive later on in the afternoon, would stay next door! After lengthy conversations and a call to the local Expedia office they eventually found a room by moving the belongings of some of their other guests into storage whilst they were temporarily away.These guests were later to be seen complaining at reception. Our so called 'deluxe' room had a view of a stack of 10 broken toilets and a large back wall. We were woken in the morning by heavy traffic down the uncarpeted corridor outside our room. The hotel catering facilities were virtually non-existent. The breakfast was acceptable but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sundevil2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Uyan for two nights and could not have been any more happier. We were upgraded to a deluxe suite at no extra cost due to space availability. Extremely clean room with a very large sitting area and large bathroom with a jacuzzi tub. A wonderful view from the roof top dining and sitting area. Hotel staff was very friendly and seemed to go out of their way to help, and spoke very good English. Breakfast was included which consisted of grain cereals, selection of cheeses, meats, hard boiled eggs, breads, juices, coffee and teas. The location was very central and was within easy walking distance to all the major sites to see in the old part of the city, and in a very safe area. The Four Season Hotel is right next door. The Hotel Uyan was more than we expected for a smallish boutique hotel, and should not be overlooked when deciding on hotel accommodations in Istanbul. It was so much more quaint than the big hotel chains.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel for a decent price!”
Reviews.Author: monika992
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went over spring beak last March. Since we were on a students budget, this proved to be the most economical-yet-nice hotel I could find. The prices were great, the location great, and the rooms and hotel decor in general were beautiful. I don't like to stay in squalor even though I am a poor student..and while this was a little more expensive than a hostel, it was still affordable for us, and we got SO much for our money. 1) Location is excellent. walk to all major tourist destinations, a little convenient store, a nice cafe where you can get delicious apple tea and turkish coffee and smoke hookah. 2) We were so lucky - we booked the smallest of the small room, which was the cheapest, but the first two nights I guess they had filled up the small rooms or there was some complication so we got to stay in the deluxe room at the same price as the small room. it was GORGEOUS. Decorated amazingly, nice bed, gorgeous brand new looking bathroom. Amazing. Granted our last two days when they moved us back to the small room..it is SMALL! You can barely move. So I say if you can afford a deluxe, go with a deluxe. 3) The staff was extremely nice and helpful. Overall, a great stay! Best possible choice for us.

Reviews.Title: “I could not have been more pleased!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm a single senior citizen who stayed at the Uyan Hotel from May 3 to May 10. Prior to my trip I looked at numerous web sites at various hotels. Because I flew on a frequent flier ticket ($91 RT international business class from Knoxville, TN) I felt that I could pay a little more to stay in an upscale hotel rather than in places like I normally stay, NOT as upscale as the Four Seasons though which is three times the price at their lowest rate and only 30 meters away! I had no outside recommendations for the hotel. From the time the shuttle picked me up at the airport (n/c too) after my long flight from Knoxville, TN to when the shuttle took me back to the airport at 3 AM for my departure my hotel experience was excellent. I was met with a friendly and helpful staff, Genghis (not spelled correctly, sorry) was all smiles every time I saw him and at breakfast too, he even made an omlette for me for breakfast even though he didn't for other guests. All I did was ask! My superior deluxe room was fantastic, room 302, on the front of the building, no noise, had the windows open and heard the calls to prayer at night, the room was spotless, vistas fantastic from the roof, the king size bed and down comforter begged me to relax, M. Uyan actually exists too, he's a extremely nice grandfather type man who was so cordial to me I felt like family. And he told me that hotel guests receive a 40% discount at his rug and ceramics store next door. There are good restaurants close to the hotel even though the reviews said that there are not. Believe me, I didn't go hungry! Be sure to go out the front door, turn left to the corner, and left immediately to the restaurant on the left. It was popular and has good foods too. And the rooms have a mini refrig so you can buy yogurt or something at the store rather than eating out all the time, or when you get hungry late at night, or if you don't want to go up to the 4th floor for their excellent breakfast. Like every other hotel though, the prices for the items (sodas and beer) in the refrig are high, so just go to the store! The location is excellent, everything from the sea to the historial places, to the Galata Bridge, to the University, the Grand Bazaar, and the Hippodrome is within walking distance. This was my first trip to Turkey, I didn't know what to expect. I didn't expect the friendliness in general, and was rather annoyed at being approached on the streets for the invariable hustle of some sort, but I became used to it and could avoid it. I always take Knoxville chocolates with me when I travel (the owner of the chocolate factory is a friend) because I'd rather give something that is more personal than a tip could possibly be. And Genghis said that everyone said they were really good too. A little friendliness in return to the staff in the hospitality industry is always more than welcomed. I met wonderful people on the trip ranging from a couple from Texas, people from Istanbul, Kurdish Istanbul residents, and all without exception were friendly and I felt welcomed and comfortable at all times. My hat is off to Mr. Uyan, the Uyan Hotel, and it's staff for making this a remorable vacation for me. Time to start planning my next trip!

HotelInfo.Address: Utangac Sokak No 25 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34122, Turkey
